description:
Best cocktails in the city hands down. Gets packed but it wasn't too bad when we visited during the week. There's seating towards the back and ample standing room in the front.

Bartenders get busy real quick so make sure to flag one immediately. The menu pretty much has something for everyone and all four drinks we ordered were delicious.

Quite frankly, I'm just mad I don't live/work closer to PCH so I can visit more often.
author: Arezou A.

description:
Really impressed by PCH, and I can see this becoming one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city. All three of the cocktails pictured (forgot the names, there's a lot of them and they all have weird names!) were unique and had interesting flavors.

Be warned, this bar definitely exemplifies city pricing, so don't expect a cheap bill if you have more than a drink or two here.

Come here for a happy hour or a drink before dinner (it'll be less crowded), or make it a stop on a bar crawl in the Nob Hill area.
author: Kedar V.

description:
Favorite cocktail place in the city hands down. Delicious and inventive cocktails. My favorites are the Silk road and Lime in da coconut.

Small space and gets crowded quickly.
author: Jenny J.

description:
Came across this place in my zealous hunt for bars in downtown San Francisco. It's dimly lit, but there's a lot of seating both at the bar itself and towards the back, where there are comfy lounges. The leather-bound menu was also very cute, with extensive pages of drinks. 

I ordered a lime in da cocunut, made with reyka vodka, coconut lychee milk, citrus, and topped off with salted pistachios. An absolutely delicious drink that didn't taste strong at all. I savored each sip. However, the entire glass was filled with little chunks of ice--not the normal cube shaped ones that allow more liquid to permeate through the empty spaces. These little ice chunks fit tightly together, meaning that though the glass was very tall, there was actually very little of the drink inside. It's a pretty big complaint I have, especially since I paid about $16 for the drink after tax/tips. Taste wise, however, this drink was perfect for me. 

My friend ordered the thrilla in Manila, made with Evan Williams bourbon, shiso, calamansi, coconute, absinthe, and li-hing mui. It was a fruity drink that also tasted good. 

All in all, a nice place to go for delicious tasting alcoholic drinks. It's a nice place to kick back and relax. The staff were very welcoming and nice. They allow you to go next door to Hogwash (a pub) and order food and bring it to the bar, as this bar itself does not serve any food.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Tasty, Instagramable, and SF priced is how I would describe the cocktails that PCH serves. For the first two reasons, there usually isn't a time when PCH isn't packed after work hours. It can be a little chaotic trying to get the bartender's attention to place your drink order, but if you're able to secure a table in the back, the rest of your evening will be a lot less stressful. With a table and/or seat, somebody will come over to take your drink order, and you can now order food and not have to juggle a plate and a cocktail between your two hands. Whew.

As it's been a while since I've gone to PCH, I can't remember the exact drink I ordered. However, I do recall that PCH has a very expansive menu that's sorted by liquor. No matter what your preference is, I'm sure PCH will have a cocktail for you. I always opt for the drinks that include some sort of spicy element and I definitely was able to find something on the menu that fit the bill. If you have a friend who's visiting from out of town, I'd recommend taking them over to check out PCH (maybe go before dinner when it's likely to be less crowded). It's super close to Union Square/BART, and it has a lot of elements that popular bars in SF have these days.
author: Austin W.

description: I just got a job in the FiDi and one of the unexpected perks is being near this gem. Great service, even when it gets busy, and strong but balanced drinks. I came here with a group of friends, all with different taste, and we were each able to find something on the menu that we positively loved. My cocktail of choice? The "Return Of The Mack," hands down. Sweet but not cloyingly so, a tad salty (in a delicious way), and a nice frothy head of egg white to even out the strong taste. One of my fave bars in SF!
author: Imani B.

description:
So how does one Judge a bar or a "Purveyor of Mixology".

Is it the beautiful people? The Vibe? The ambiance? Cheap Drinks??

Welp for me if you can make a mean Vieux Carre you are a bad ass bar imho.

PCH does an amazing Vieux Carre ( actually Francis does!) but they do so much more exceptionally well that this could be one of the best in San Francisco.

Simple small bar with a discreet outside you could easily pass by without a notice. Bartenders are great...you can tell them your preference for ingredients or flavors and they will make you an Elixir of the Gods.

I especially love their Critical Mass ( if you have ever driven on a third Friday in SF you'll know the other much hated critical mass!): wild turkey 101 rye, aperol, benedictine, green chartreuse, sweet vermouth....it's an awesome cocktail.

Several drinks come with a chilled sidecar: a 1/2 extra portion of your cocktail. Very few bars do this and makes the cost of cocktail's very reasonable imho.

Actually I've never had a bad cocktail here.

Go early as the place gets mobbed.
author: David G.

description: Solid place for a few drinks. I like the drink with mezcal and cucumber which seemed to be a special from a few months back and not on their regular menu but they still made it for me anyways (called Witch Hazel?). Had some other drinks and didn't love all of them but I think it's personal preference.
author: Sophia L.

description: One of the best experiences...the cocktails were so creative and the mixologists were very knowledgeable  and friendly.  Non-pretentious. My gf and I tried 6 different drinks between us. If we didn't have dinner plans we would have liked to try more.  She even came back the next day with a few other friends. Go early before it gets busy to converse with the mixologists to learn a little about the drinks that they create...that's if that is your kind of thing...:) cheers!
author: Spoon P.

description: This is a great place for happy hour after work or before dinner. I am always amazed with their Negroni, there's a twist of pandan in there and it just blows my mind! I also really love their Coffee drink - turn down for nut! Great cocktails!
author: Kelly L.

description: Extensive beer and liquor selection and tons of chic mixology options. No attitude though and they're more than willing to mix up something special for you.
author: Paul D.

description:
If I could afford to guzzle $14 cocktails all day, every day... I would camp out at the bar here. Apparently there is a happy hour, but it's best I don't know.

This place is on another level for craft cocktails. It's not just "let's barrel age and dress up a negroni" - this is something new. The carefully thought out glassware you are handed will contain a textural and flavor combination completely unknown to you until this moment. Cilantro flowers, flaming cinnamon sticks, mystery garnishes will surprise and delight. I've brought several visitors from out of town and they've really enjoyed it.
author: Billy D.

description:
The Pornstar drink here, with the passionfruit is delicious! It is rich, fruity, perfectly sweet and just an overall enjoyable drink. Probably one of my favorite drinks I've gotten at a cocktail bar in a while, so this bar gets high ratings just for that!

The other drinks were good as well, I had a smoky melon tasting one which was excellent, had rich flavor, quite a bit of depth, and a nice blend of different tastes, ranging from the saltiness, to the sweetness to the light bitterness of the alcohol.

The place also has a decent amount of seating and standing space so you can lounge around and talk with your friends for quite some time. Overall an excellent place and one of the cocktail lounges I like more in the area.
author: Tyler T.

description:
This is a great place for a date-- awesome drinks and pretty intimate without trying too hard. I went for a simple Pimm's cup but my drink was great and I had no complaints. I do wish this place served food-- some truffle fries would have been the perfect addition.

I would definitely recommend Pacific Cocktail Haven if you're looking for a place to enjoy a great drink over conversation.
author: Megan K.

description:
MY 500th Review goes to.......A great little bar that helped me get my night started!!! 
This place is what everyone should think of when "handcrafted cocktails" comes to mind. There's a real technique that goes into making a great drink. This bar has it. 
Small but quaint and has nothing but hipsters chillin here.
They have happy hour till 7 everyday with some basic but tasty drinks on the menu.
The real creativity is in the specialty drink menu. Sorted by alcohol, each drink has some interesting ingredients. The Swizzle my nizzle was perfect! It was sweet and tart and beautiful to look at. I could have had 10.
I had a great time here. Check it out!
author: Ada J.

description:
Yessss to all the cocktails here! 

Came on a Friday night actually because Smuggler's Cove was waay over capacity, but I'm super glad we did. This place was way more chill, which actual breathing room, ample bartenders, and seating. Probably a nice place for a date (like most people we people-watched for fun).

All the drinks on their drink menu were super intriguing-sounding--I really didn't know where to start. They all have great names and fun ingredients! While each cocktail drink was about $14, they were all pretty generous and looked super nice.

I ended up trying the Miso Old Fashioned (yeah, I'm not that old fashioned usually but wanted to see what the miso was about), Lime in da Coconut (intrigued with coconut-lychee milk), and Sweating in a Sundress (had almond milk and mango). All of them were sweet, tasty, and went down easy even though they were pretty strong. 

They even have punch bowls for groups--got to come back for sure for a chill time and so many more drinks to try!
author: Clarissa C.

description: Crack. Pornstar martini w/ passion fruit. Soooo goooooooooooooooooood. We'll be back again. Swizzle my nizzle. Pootie tang.
author: Matt C.

description: Came here on a Wednesday after work and found 2-hour street parking nearby. There was still seating inside around 6. I ordered 2 drinks - Toki Hi-Ball and Silk Road. The Toki was very light; I wouldn't order it again. However, the Silk Road was super good! The Japanese curry really completes pineapple... Who would've known? Service was very good - a server was very attentive in making sure we had everything we need at multiple times. This is a great place to grab a 1 hourish drink(s) with a few friends. I thought I saw a food menu online but did not see one, which would have been nice for my non-alcohol-consuming friends.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I came here to catch up with an old college friend. I ordered a whiskey cocktail called the Thrilla in Manila while my friend ordered an agave drink, the Swizzle My Nizzle.

This place is very fun - from their uniquely created cocktail names to the decorative cocktails themselves. Surprisingly, the place was not that crowded and people were already filing out around 8pm on a Friday! If you come and there are no more seats at the bar, I believe there are tables further down inside. 

The Thrilla in Manila was really good! However, depending on your preference I did not find my drink to be particularly strong. Instead, it was very sweet and heavy on the coconut flavor. Considering I was drinking on an empty stomach and left without a buzz, I am positive that there was no alcohol in my drink! 

This place has great reviews and came highly recommended to me, so despite their drinks being weaker, I want to come back and try their other creatively named cocktails. This place also just has a great vibe. The noise level was not too loud to prevent you from having any sort of conversation and (was) located right across the street to the Color Museum.
author: Brandon S.

description:
I'm too old for this crowd. No: this crowd is too young to be enjoying cocktails this good. 

This is not a quiet and orderly Tokyo-style bar. Nor is it a dark and moody speakeasy. Noisy, frenetic, ceaseless. Full of groups. Fun. 

Surprisingly, the quality and imaginativeness of the cocktails did not suffer. My bartender was dizzying to watch - multitasking and constantly moving. In amongst some nicely done menu items (the vegetal  'Oh Snap', the mouthful 'Salaryman' overflowing into a wooden masu cup, the nicely bitter 'Leeward Negroni') I was also served a bespoke cocktail on request. 

Wow. A fun night.
author: Richard L.

description:
I liked this very unassuming spot, with it's dark atmosphere and tiki-adjacent drink menu. 

Came here with a big group on our first night in SF. Granted it was a Thursday, but I was happy the place was pretty empty, meaning we got attention from the staff and drinks came fairly quickly. 

We tried all manor of things, including a few holiday items (mine was fig based!). I have to say all the drinks were pretty good. Prices are what you'd expect when ordering fancy cocktails from a nice bar in a big city. 

Overall a nice spot that I'd recommend if you're looking for a low-key type of night!

Stay Cheerful ;)
author: Garen A.

description:
I love everything about this place.

Everyone here was so nice!!! Friendly! Cool! Just what you want from bartenders!! 
I was able to joke with them! 

The drinks were wonderfully sized, unique, and delicious! I love all of the variety. We also loved that no one was like uptight about their aesthetic. 
Like, they get it, it's a bar. And they let you bring in food. And if you're not going to let me bring in food, or be weird about it, I'm not going.

But anyway, yeah. I want to make a trip to the city just for this place.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Another cocktail bar that has pretty much everything I want in a drinking spot. A rotating inventive cocktails menu, but can also make the classics. The good liquors are available if one prefers just sipping. Bartenders are friendly and attentive, awesome when they're so busy and all.

Currently, this bar is in a holiday mood. Festive cocktails with Christmas decorations are all over the place. It is quite fun and will put you in holiday spirits if the outside surroundings doesn't.

Note this is a pre- or post-dinner spot but will let you bring food in. And, it does get crowded on the weekends. be conscious of when you show up, or go on school nights like us locals.
author: Peter L.

description:
Hands down, the best cocktail bar right now in the city. For me, it's all about the ambiance, the crowd control, the style/decor, and finally, the creative cocktails. This place does a great job with mixing a variation of ingredients from South American spices, Asian ingredients, and SF style creations. 

I'd like to give Francis a huge shout out for taking good care of me and my company. He is everything a bartender should be. He's skilled, knowledgable, swift and super attentive.This guy is knocking down a couple drinks while taking down orders down the line. He's top notch. Me, my cousin and friend basically stayed here for 2 hrs last night. From 4pm-6pm ish. We had around five drinks including some shots. 

Last night was their showcasing of their holiday menu which contained about 15 cocktails all within the holiday category. They had mixes from egg yolk, nutmeg, Mexican chocolate, peppermint to even gingerbread whiskey. I also had to order their special which was a Kung Fu Pandan. If you know what pandan is and taste like, then I totally recommend this!!! So far my favorite mix. Drinks range from $10-$15 which is typical SF cocktail prices. This is the only bar up to date where the ingredients & mixes are different and truly out of this world in terms of creativity. 

This place can get packed quick (within the opening hour) so I totally recommend arriving early and grabbing a seat at the bar. Last night they had classic holiday music, lights hanging everywhere, Christmas decor, and even the bartenders were decked in holiday clothing. They have plenty of seats but the front lobby can be narrow as hell when packed so prepare to squeeze through a sea of people. 

I will be coming back for more and this time with more people!
author: Allister D.

description:
I'm obsessed with PCH. I met up with Nina Y. here for drinks, and I wish I could have stayed longer, but it was just for a brief night cap. PCH is pretty dark and swanky when you walk in, lit by the tabletop candles throughout the bar. We were seated at a barstool table for two. It was a little chilly since we were in the "line of sight" of the outdoor wind.

Anyways, I love that the drink menu is sorted by spirit. Easy to find exactly what you're looking for. I decided on the Tuk Tuk Tea, which is basically alcoholic Thai tea. I'm not usually a fan of Thai tea, but it sounded like a delicious combination of ingredients... and it was. Super strong, flavorful, and beautifully presented. How can you turn down scotch, cognac, laphroaig, honey, thai tea, and cream?

Like I said, I wasn't here for very long, but I'd love to come back to try more of their cocktails. Perhaps for a happy hour? This is a smooth operation, and I love reading more about them on their website. About the pineapple logo. About the fact that the owners also run Press Club. About being able to book PCH for private events. The possibilities are endless!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Love this cute, random spot I found in downtown sf! Super cute and intimate ambiance. 

We ordered:
- Swizzle My Nizzle ($14) Tequila
- Ko'Olina Swizzle ($14) Rum and had a hint of spice to it 
- Lime in da Coconut ($14) My favorite! Tasted like a very mild pina coloda 
- Stop and smell the Ros'e ($14) Yum! Similar to a light sangria. Nice and fruity with a hint of wine taste to it 

Super friendly service! Would definitely be back and recommend this place.
author: Miranda T.

description:
We came here on a Monday night after going to the MOIC, and we were so glad to have stumbled upon PCH! The ambiance was nice; laid back crowd that paired well with the dim lighting and candles at each booth. 

The menu was extensive, but very well organized. There were different pages on the menu for each type of alcohol; everything looked so good that it took us quite awhile to order. Each of us ordered one drink: Simple Jack, Lime in Da Coconut, Tokyo Drift. We were definitely tempted to try one of the punch bowls, but decided to take it easy on a Monday night. 

All of the drinks were equally good, with great finishes and not too much ice or mixer. There were a lot of interesting flavor combinations, which I never would have imagine together, but greatly enjoyed. The bartenders were super friendly, and helped us make our decisions. We greatly enjoyed PCH, and will be back any time we're in the area!
author: Prathna M.

description:
I love this bar. The servers are really friendly and the ambiance is perfect for date night or a night out with your besties. It doesn't hurt that it is a short, albeit a little hilly, walk from the Powell Street station.

We came here on a Thursday in search of good Filipino food from Pinoy Heritage, which was the pop-up restaurant that evening. We were lucky to find a table right away upon getting there. I ordered one of the special cocktails on the Pinoy Heritage menu, and the hubby ordered a glass of wine. Loved my cocktail which had gin, calamansi and Green Chartreuse. So refreshing and not sweet. 

I look forward to returning, even without Pinoy Heritage as the pop-up restaurant. I definitely want to try one of their many special cocktails!
author: Hazel C.

description: I thought this spot looked enticing. Cocktails could be from $12-18. The interior was not as nice as I thought it would be and it was dim in lighting. We found a spot to sit in as a group was leaving. People got some drinks and I sipped them. I tried the Cane Jane(from Zane) haha! Pretty neat creative bar like a creative cafe. I wouldn't say it felt so hipster. Since it is located near Union Square downtown, there are after-work professionals.
author: Denise C.

description: Unexpectedly one of my favorite local bars in SF. But more importantly, serving my favorite cocktail of all time. Just trust me. Try their Porn Star Martini now and thank me later. Comes with half a passion fruit and a shot of bubbly on the side. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Heavenly!
author: Tayler H.

description: You can't go wrong with PCH. The menu is extensive and you can guarantee that each cocktail on the menu hits the perfect intersection between wildly creative and delicious. This place has plenty of seating, both at the bar and at various cozy couches or tables in the back. The service is great too! Plenty of water refills and the server came around super frequently to check for more rounds of cocktails.
author: Claire C.

description: Beautiful and well crafted cocktails with good service. I wish there were some food items or snacks because I like to munch on something when I'm drinking but they focus on drinks and do it well. Very extensive menu with each page dedicated to a spirit.
author: Marilynn L.

description:
Love this spot! Super cute pineapple themed decor. 
The menu was extensive, with each page of the menu featuring cocktails with a different alcohol as the base.
I wanted something sweet, so I just told the bartender to make me any gin based drink he sees fit. He ended up making me a gin drink with snap peas in it (forgot the name, but it's on the menu) and it was really refreshing and tasty. Everyone in my group had drinks that tasted great. Will be back!
author: Sijia Z.

description:
Tiki drinks galore! Ambiance is a divey, but with such finesse! 
If you ever find yourself on that Liholiho Yacht Club waitlist (that can be grueling hours), I would highly recommend you spend your wait time here at PCH. In fact, if you ever find yourself in this general area, I would say go to PCH. By general area - let's say, San Francisco lol  

The drinks are all fascinating, unique, and delicious (usually ranging from $12-13). My friend had a Tuk Tuk (alcoholic thai tea), and it was magnificent. I normally don't like already tasty drinks like that mixed with any form of liquor but it really worked! I tried the Ko'olina (comes with a dried pineapple slice!) and it was beautifully crafted, but I think the Tuk Tuk took the cake on that one! We were just about to order our next rounds when Liholiho called our number. Can you imagine - one of the top restaurants in SF with a wait time of typically 3 hours calling us to let us know our table is ready - and all we could feel was disappointment that we weren't able to try more drinks at PCH. I think that might give you some idea of how creative and worth a visit this place is! 

It's definitely a haven and I'm definitely returning!
author: Deanna S.

description:
Solid tiki drinks. Chill ambiance.  

Enjoyed the "lime in the coconut" tropical flavors and other tiki drinks without having to listen to super loud music and rainstorms at Tonga Room(Tonga room is fun, but kitschy to the max)

Extra points/stars because this month PCH is home to Miracle bar, aka an "aggressively festive holiday pop-up bar" according to Eater SF. This is the most accurate description and words cannot even describe it.  Drinks were festive and came in Santa mugs or other holiday drinkware.  Very very crowded but worth checking out!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
One of the best cocktail bars in the world. All the bar tenders are top notch. The attention to detail is bar none - glasses are spectacular and extremely clean, the ice is the best, and atmosphere is inviting.

I highly recommend starting with something off the menu but then quickly move to discussing what you like with one of the bar tenders and let them create something off menu that suits your palate.
author: Robert B.

description:
This is my first time at a bar where I had a hard time deciding between cocktails since all of them sounded enticing! My friend and I came by for after-dinner drinks and the place was very busy at 9:30 PM. There are a few tables in the back but you probably need to come earlier to snag a seat. Luckily, two seats at the bar eventually opened up and we were able to avoid standing in the crowded area by the bar.

All of the drinks we tried were flavorful, yummy, and strong enough to get your buzz on. I loved the variety in presentation and pretty glasses they used. I also appreciated that they separated the drink menu by spirits, which helps to narrow down your choice from their many options.

The staff was friendly and attentive, even when the bar was packed on a Saturday night. If I had to pick one thing to improve upon, it would be to dress up the interior a little nicer to match the glory of their cocktails. However, it's quite dim inside so I guess it doesn't matter that much.

PCH is now at the top of my list of spots in SF for a delicious drink. Can't wait to come back and try more cocktails!
author: Tina H.

description:
Loved this place. We held a customer event here and everyone loved it. Great ambience, fabulous cocktails and excellent service. Even the finger food we had here was very good. The beef on chips was my personal favourite. 

The cocktail list is extensive and of course if you ask for an obscure cocktail you are likely to get it. They are made well, served nicely and I specially loved the Pisco Sour they made me. It was excellent. 

Definitely come back here any day :-)
author: Sam S.

description:
Pacific Cocktail Haven is such a fun bar! I went while they had the holiday pop up and had a bunch of special holiday themed cocktails. I had the You'll Shoot Your Rye Out, which was a delicious pumpkin cocktail and I had quite a few others but I can't remember the names.

The bar itself was super Christmas decorated and it made the atmosphere so much fun. The music was all Christmas music too. The bartenders were super friendly and pretty quick for being really busy. I really can not wait to go back on a regular night and try out some of their normal cocktails and I definitely want to take some of my friends there to check it out as well.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I have had the chance to try PCH multiple times. I had something new that blew my mind. I guess my all time favorite is Leeward negroni (with sweet pandan taste and aroma). In addition to bar seating, they have different configurations at the back. If you come a little earlier in the evening, the place is also more quiet to catch up with your company over great drinks. In my mind, PCH (along with Trick dog) is the best cocktail bars in SF.
author: Doruk B.

description: I finally got a chance to try the cocktails here and I got to say the cocktails are pretty good here. On my 2 previous visits I never got a chance to try the cocktails cause the place was way to packed.    This place is pretty small ,the walk way to the back is Narrow you got to pretty much rub up against people to get to the back. But the cocktails make up for it. I got the Hall pass and it was good and I felt it right away, I've had drinks at other places and as soon as I'm done the frost  thing I say is Was there any alcohol in that. I will be back here for some  more bomb cocktails.
author: Dennis T.

description:
The drinks here are really great! I love their stylistic and trendy menu, that comes with some sketches of the drinks as well as explanations of the different cocktails and flavors. 

I got the Ko'Olina Swizzle (rum) on multiple occasions because I just love it that much! The drinks are all really pretty. I have gone back with different friends because I think the drinks and vibe here are great and worth the price and I wanted all my friends to experience it!

However, one downside is that there isn't much seating or space for large groups.
author: Hanna K.

description:
PCH is now probably my new favourite bar in the world. I have nothing bad to say about this place. From the gentleman at the door to the servers and bartenders, everyone was tremendously nice and welcoming. The decor was great. They have a cool wall painted in the style of airport suitcase tags that also include recipes for transitional drinks from those countries. 

In terms of the actual drinks, there was a variety to choose from that is appealing whether you like a more intricate cocktail or a classic old fashioned. 

I don't think I've ever had better cocktails. The Return of the Mack was my favourite. It is a tequila, mezcal based drink that also includes an egg white foam on top. Each sip was bursting with new flavours while not being too much at the same time.
Silk Road was another fantastic drink that was a little more on the fruity side. We had four drinks and based on that sample, I think they don't have a bad drink on the menu. 

A pineapple is definitely the international sign of hospitality.
author: Mati K.

description:
Came here yesterday to meet some friends from out of town for drinks. Unfortunately, they were caught in typical SF traffic and weren't able to make it, but I dropped in for a Swizzle My Nizzle, which I can best describe as a spicy tequila sunrise w/ passion fruit. I'm more of a tart than sweet kind of guy (maybe that says a lot about me), but the drink was a bit sweet for my taste. It was still well-made, and I'm sure others w/ an affinity for sweet and spicy would have enjoyed it. 

Ambiance was a bit bustling, and it was pretty loud inside with minimal seating. Drinks and service were still served quickly and were quality. Was glad to finally try this place out.
author: Ravi K.

description:
For those who are alcohol allergic:
Great mocktails, always give them some direction for what you might want (citrus-y, berry notes). We got something with coconut juice and it was great!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Where can I begin. So I'll start here. I've been in this industry for 15 years and have considered myself a professional bartender for maybe 5. I've been on a sangria binge for a while now and tried yelping places close to this area and didn't find one. I found this place on yelp and decided to try it. I came in and asked Ann Marie if she had one on her menu and she said no but "I'd be happy to make an in house one for you."  I was sold. Being a full mixology bar with fresh ingredients, in house made syrups and tinctures she concocted a sangria and we played around with the ingredients and eventually found the one that I wanted. An expertly maintained and run bar which focuses on attention to detail, which in any industry, leads you to become the best of the best. 

If your into intricately crafted cocktails, and a good atmosphere: good lighting, good music pretty much everything that touches your senses, this is the place. I drink a lot and love all types of bars depending on my mood. I live in LA but will continue coming back to this bar every time I come back to SF.
author: Han-Sol H.

description:
Okay, drinks are nice but let's talk about my experience. 

Walking into the door the bouncer did not appear yet and had a woman younger than me checking ID's She thought my ID was fake- I'M ALMOST 30! She was holding onto it until she could correctly tell if it was fake or not. (When in doubt, use a scanner). 

The bar was so crowded. Took me 15 minutes to wait to place an order and extra 20 minutes to get the drink. I ordered the Lime in the Coconut. It was delicious but mostly ice. When I placed the order I asked them to close my card at (I was standing at the POS machine w tender.) He took my card. I asked him again to please close my card. 60 minutes later, nothing. It's now about 11pm and I forgot about the card... left and experienced my first leaving my card at the bar experience. 

I live on the peninsula and was not going back to city for card. I emailed them and will update the review accordingly based on the response.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Amazing spot!  A little pricey but expected for a cocktail bar.  Each drink is around $13, handmade with love, and absolutely worth it.  I had the Swizzle my Nizzle (tequila, passionfruit, vanilla, lime, and habanero bitters) and it was delish.  I tried quite a few drinks actually... As a group of 6, we each tried something different so I got to sample quite a few.

One of my favorites was the Do Re Mi with rose syrup, and it comes with an adorable mini clothespin + herbs.  Would definitely recommend this!  You can't really go wrong with any of the cocktails, they're all super well done and taste good.

Even on a Friday night around 9PM we were able to get a table for 6 people without hardly waiting.  The waiters do a stellar job at trying to find your party a table and letting you know when tables open up.  Considering this is a bar and not a restaurant - I found this especially considerate.  

The place is pretty small and gets very loud.  You pretty much have to yell to be able to talk to each other, so don't plan on having some deep intimate conversation.  There are bathrooms, and it seems like there's a downstairs available but it was blocked off when we went.  This would be a great spot to come on a weekend for a cocktail or two, or even a happy hour!
author: Kenna H.

description: A small, fun cocktail bar with a wide variety of very interesting drinks. It can get a little crowded and tight inside, but it's worth it given the eclectic ingredients in their fancy cocktails!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I was looking for a bar not too far from Bart but something I hadn't tried before. Based on the reviews, Pacific Cocktail Haven (PCH) was a no brainer. And shocked that it was right next to Hogwash - I had definitely walked past this place before so glad I could finally go inside.

The decor isn't going to blow anyone away - it's very similar to a lot of the modern cocktail bars - a slightly industrial vibe with the exposed metal beams; a long gorgeous bar, and some cool seats in the back for groups or dates that got lucky on their timing. 

I arrived a bit before my date and had a chance to look over the menu and understand why the place was packed before 7 on a Sunday. They have a solid happy hour menu until 7 every day. 

But beyond the HH menu, the menu is diverse but organized by spirit. There is a page for Agave beverages, multiple rum pages, a few with Whisk(e)y. What I really loved was some of the names like Simple Jack, Ultra Magnus (I'm a Transformers geek so debated getting this just out of the name). Also they have pictures of all the cocktails next to the drink to prepare you for what you are getting. I ended up with the Shizzle My Nizzle but substituted Mezcal. It was a great smokey, sweet, citrusy, and spicy cocktail - which is what I want out of my mezcal cocktails. 

The service was solid, with two bar tenders handing out the menu the second you walk in, and a server helping those at the tables or back seating area. Prices were okay - $14 per cocktail, but they don't skimp here.

So if in the area and looking for a solid craft cocktail on a date or meeting with friends, can highly recommend PCH.
author: Michael C.

description: This is a great place to grab a unique and delicious cocktail. We were in town for a wedding and stayed at the Hotel Beresford nearby and decided to check this place out. Really nice vibe here, cool decor, attentive bartenders, and like I said - really good cocktails.  If I lived in the area, this would be my hangout.
author: Peter G.

description:
I've been to PCH about 4 times now in 2017 and I don't even live in SF! I live in Chicago! I'm lucky enough to be able to visit SF so often, which allows the repeat visits. Truly a fan of this place. Craft cocktails in an industrial setting. The bartenders are friendly, professional, and they know what they're doing. I love their aprons :)

The cocktail list is pretty extensive with sections that focus on different liquors.
author: Teri Y.

description:
Their cocktails are awesome and delicious. I make it a point to go to at least a couple craft cocktail bars at any city I travel to, and after a while, all of them kind of start to blend together. So I was really happy that all the cocktails I ordered from PCH were memorable and innovative. It got crowded pretty quickly so I stood sandwiched in between others in front of the bar, but I don't regret coming at all. 

Kung Fu Pandan - whisky-based cocktail that's a special on the board, not in the menu. This was my favorite - if you like pandan, then you'll love this too. It has a slightly savory yet sweet finish. 

Miso Old-Fashioned - miso-butter rum, pommeau & bitters. This had a unique umami twist to it that came through without being overpowered by the alcohol.

Thrilla in Manilla - shiso, calamansi, coconut, absinthe, li-hing mui, bourbon. If you don't like cocktails that taste like alcohol, this is for you. The best part was the sprinkling of li-hing mui powder on top, which gave me intense nostalgia to my time in Hawaii, but that's another story. 

Overall, I would highly recommend PCH if you're in town.
author: Jen L.

description:
Wow this is definitely my new favorite bar in the city. Usually don't write reviews for bars because I forget or they don't make an impact, just a place you go in and out. Well anyways they have drinks specials and a menu with witty names, not in a corny rolling your eyes kind of way but wow I see why that's named that way. For example they had two specials the "King fu-pandan" and the Jeepney" the KFP highlighting taste of "Buko pandan" a familiar "south East Asian" flavor reminiscent of young coconut, or that green jello drink. The jeepney is a Filipino public taxi/bus but I forgot what was in it. Highlights you should try is the r
Tuk tuk tea (an alcoholic Thai tea), and the thrilla in Manila, but you really can't go wrong with this place. They have a happy hour too
author: Jenelle G.

description:
My favorite bar in the city. Despite how crowded it can get for such a small spot, I've inexplicably never NOT been able to find a seat. Large part due to servers finding you a spot right when you need it.

They retired my favorite drink (you'll be missed dearly, scotch Thai tea) but that's also a strong point of this bar in that I've been able to get something new every time I've gone. Even something as strange sounding as a Curry flavored cocktail nails its execution. They also have punch for big groups... or courageous small groups!

Love this moody corner of the city: its music and lighting is the perfect kind of turn down. Careful of bringing friends who fall asleep.
author: Stephen P.

description:
What better day to review this awesome place than on the day I got Elite gold and also my birthday! Poised for drinking!

The holiday drinks here are just plain awesome -- the cups, the flavors (melted peppermint ice creamish, anyone), and the venue. It just warms my jingly heart. Great place to hang out with friends and be merry. Only downside is they are very uppity about keeping an aisle to get to the back bathroom area...it's a bar, don't police aisles. 

The drinks are so bomb and the vibe is great. Holiday spirit galore with the decor. Fun at PCH! Come on, it's called Pacific Cocktail Haven.
author: Libby J.

description: I really loved this spot! They have a variety of drink options so you're bound to find one you like. Also, the drinks are really unique, fruity, and delicious. The prices of the cocktails are reasonable, ranging from around $12-$18.
author: Helen z.

description: Good dimly lit cocktail bar in downtown SF. Not a place to meet up with more than a couple others and a bit pricey (though most SF cocktail bars are). One of the best cocktail bars in the area though
author: Clayton B.

description:
Several of my fellow yelpers including Joe Cool came here after the recent San Francisco Elite event.  This is my first time here. And this is a great place to hang out and enjoy many of the blended and creative cocktails made by the gifted bartenders.  This medium-size place has a tropical ambiance with a cabin-like feel. Amazingly, the bar carries at least 200 kind of assorted spirits. 

Right off the bat, one of my favorite yelpers bought me an unknown cocktail which was one of the daily specials. But the problem is that I am strictly a beer- drinker.  I only had one small sip of the bar's famous cocktail, my palate did not agree with me. "Yes, I am very fussy!"

I am very fortunate that the bar also carries six local brews on tap, including micro-brews from the Fort Point Brewing Company; one of my favorite brew companies.  The bartender was understandable and made the exchange and gave me a pint of the light amber ale in a cold glass. My reactions did change immediately after the first sip of the brew. 

I did not want to sound like a party-pooper, but this cool bar is great place to grab a cocktail with friends. But for me, I am better off at a brewery.
author: Matt G.

description: We were sent here by a bartender over at Coqueta, and he did not steer us wrong! The space is very trendy, atmospheric, and just enough people to keep things lively but few enough so everyone had a seat or place at the bar. I had the Tuk Tuk and Sweeney's Revenge. Both were phenomenal, especially the Tuk Tuk which tasted like a more balanced Thai iced tea! If you're a pretentious cocktail lover, definitely do yourself a favor and buy a few rounds here!
author: Marissa F.

description:
Pacific Cocktail Haven on the surface appears to be "just another" tiki bar. It is so much more than that! Their cocktail menu is vast covering delicious and complex drinks using spirits varying from whiskey to rum to gin! I highly recommend their Kung Fu Pandan (whiskey), Turn Down for Nut (rum), and the Punch bowl that has Pimm's in it (not sweet at all!)

Chill spot close to the train station. Great spot for grabbing drinks after work =)
author: Frances P.

description: The service was great, bartenders are fast and artistic, however like most places in sf overpriced,small, drinks are good but nothing out of this world you can find other places with better drinks for a fraction of the price, the clientele is typical of current sf, music is loud to a point conversations become a scream match.
author: Rubens T.

description:
Pacific Cocktail Haven is a cool, hipster ish, small bar with the most amazing cocktails. I've been to many cocktail bars, but this bar did have a special kick. Lots of the drinks had Asian inspired ingredients such as pandan (this was a special that they had). Pandan is a great way to add fragrance and sweetness to a drink, it is a refreshing sweetness that you may not have experienced before. 

There is also a list of sake inspired drinks.

I had the city of dawn- Partida Blanco Tequila, fino sherry,watermelon, ancho reyes verde,
kaffir lime, citrus, bitters, with a long rectangular ice cube. It was refreshing!! 
Most cocktails on them menu are about $13. 

I can't wait to come back- the cocktails are unique and amazing!
author: Stephanie Q.

description:
Cute venue, but drinks were a little pricey - star off for that. They don't serve food, but hogwash is sort of connected so we ordered fries before our trip to the color factory 

While pricey, the drinks were good. I had the swizzle my nizzle (tequila based) and the other girls had the double Dutch (vodka based). They're a perfect balance, not too sweet & I love that mine came with the crunchy snow cone ice.
author: danielle a.

description: The drinks are different and very interesting. Came here on a Friday evening and couldn't snag a seat. There were around 6 of us so we were just standing by the wall across the bar. Luckily, there's a credenza we can put our drinks. Another 2 met us after 40 minutes and were able to snag a seat at the bar. Got another round and left. Service was alright but it does get busier and busier later in the evening.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Fantastic spot for some cocktails. The staff is amicable and helpful. You can let them get creative, or you can stick to the basics. Either way, you won't be disappointed. 

Highly recommended. ​
author: Felix C.

description: This is a great, central spot with a sophisticated tiki vibe. The drink menu is constantly changing and - surprise delight - always has a few Filipino-inspired cocktails with a heavy dose of calamansi and pandan!
author: Morgan G.

description: Super hip and fun bar. Cocktails are amazing! We went for the holidays and everything was Christmas themed, including the drinks, we had a great time and I can't wait to go back again on our next visit to San Fran!
author: Laura R.

description:
Excellent cocktail bar in San Francisco. 
They have a variety of drinks and a great menu . The bar is very low key and trendy at the same time . Very calm and serene atmosphere .
Absolutely check out this cocktail bar if you are in the area .
You can't go wrong with their drinks . 

 Came here around 10:30pm it wasn't too packed however just the right amount of people to make this bar enticing . 

We sat at the bar it was very interesting to see the bar tender make the drinks in front of us and explain what each thing was when we had questions .
My only complaint is that it was a bit chilly that night and the bar kept the door open which made it pretty chilly to sit at the bar for too long .

Ended up doing one round of drinks and left because of the cold however an absolute must check out cocktail bar .

I ordered a Pyrenees crossing cocktail it was heavenly . Not too strong but just the right amount .
author: Binita S.

description: Definitely one of the best cocktail place in San Francisco. This place really understand craft cocktail. Every bartenders take pride in their creation, and make sure that the customers are satisfied. I got the Smell the Roses one. I highly recommend to check this place out if you are looking for quality cocktail and a great vibe ambiance.
author: Lisa O.

description:
What an impressive bartender. I could've sat and watched him work all night. He was genuinely the entertainment. So talented and way less cocky than the cocktails & dreams movie but as entertaining or more. I dug this spot! 
Great crowd. That's always important to note right? Very different crowd from LA. Millennials of all types- extremely diverse group. Everyone was happy, yuppie-esque but cool. No buttheads or drunks to speak of. So great! 
They had an impressive cocktail list and few other places I've been can make "hand drafted creations" with such speed. I lamely stuck with vino as a carry over from dinner and was a happy camper.
The place is not refined in the least. There's no veneer of beauty to it. It's rough, loud and they have poop emoji stickers on the door leading to the bathroom- I kid you not. However, it's still a fun place and something new and different to try. It also got packed!
For sure I'd come back with a group simply to order one of those pitchers. They looked amazing and were being consumed all around me. Clearly a hit and a recommended cocktail to get here. Thanks for the great night! Will definitely be returning.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
PCH is a pretty cool little cocktail bar located right in the heart of downtown SF near union square. This place actually yields some pretty good hand crafted cocktails and has a fairly chic vibe. The space itself is decorated nicely and the bar is quite substantial, but the area is rather narrow and gets really congested when crowded. The bartenders are super friendly and really do make some good cocktail concoctions. For those of you who can't decide what you'd like, you can just have the staff make you something consisting of your favorite liquor and it tends to turn out pretty good. Overall, a nice little cocktail bar that is worthy of a visit, or several... 

Legit-
Friendly staff
Nice space
Overall ambiance 
Stiff drinks 
Cool vibes 
Great location 

Meh-
Gets really crowded 
Narrow layout gets congested 
A bit pricey
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Pacific Cocktail Haven is a tiki bar in drag.  

Where good tiki bars are over the top with kitsch and ambiance, PCH is a whispering aside to its brethren.  Such a faint whisper in fact, that one might question how one came to the conclusion that PCH is at all related to the tiki bar genre.  

It starts with the island-inspired pineapple logo which is reminiscent of something I saw long ago at SoCal's "Don the Beachcomber".   

Inside, PCH is a stunner.  The front section is dominated by a sparkly, inviting bar with a wall of attractive alcohol climbing to the rafters.  Friends of mine installed a similar bar-wall in their kitchen area and PCH's could've been the inspiration.  Alcohol bottles can be things of beauty.  

The back half of PCH is dimly lit and filled with tables and seemingly where you should go if you've planned a clandestine tete-a-tete.  The front of house was far more inviting to me but then, I wasn't in hiding.  

PCH has an extensive cocktail menu that hits upon all genres, further masking the tiki-whispering influence.  Look closely though, and you'll find the rum-based drinks and even a couple of $60 punches which serve 6 - 8 people.  They look nothing like those flaming things served in a coconut but they're "punch", which is a nod in that direction.

No food is being prepared at PCH but if you need something with which to sop up that punch indulgence you can order in from next door neighbor, Hogwash.   

Watching the bartenders do their magic I regretted that I was only up for wine.  The pour of red was generous, the service excellent.  This bar may be whispering "tiki" but it screams what it's name was saying all along: "cocktail haven".
author: Tracey A.

description:
Gee, where were the Tahitian dancers with their gyrating hips providing an ecologically sound energy source? I guess my dated expectations of another Tonga Room were dashed when Jamie W. and I came in here after attending a nearby holiday party. There's no room for a band barge anyway as it's a relatively compact yet sleek space that happens to serve upscale versions of cocktails you might find in a retro-tiki bar. Kevin Diedrich, who used to tend bar at the Burritt Room and Jasper's Tap Room, owns this place with Sidecar Hospitality, and the result is not nearly as overbearing as some of the youngsters who stagger in here.

There are about twenty creations on the menu, some quite elaborate. Jamie decided on the $13 Pootie Tang, a powerfully puckery libation with pineapple-infused H by Hine cognac, Enter black sake, coconut, absinthe, and bitters (photo: http://bit.ly/2lUCnMJ). Mine had an even more tropical twang, the $13 Lime in da Coconut with Reyka vodka, salted pistachio, coconut-lychee milk, and citrus poured over crushed ice in a tall glass (photo: http://bit.ly/2lXhPQk). I liked the flavors although the ice overwhelmed it. I kept wondering if it would have been better in a hollowed-out coconut with a pink parasol sticking out of it. Maybe not.

We weren't quite done yet, so we both ordered the $12 Cawfee Twalk, written just like Linda Richmond used to twalk, no big whoop. It was a deceptively relaxing drink with Ketel One vodka, orgeat, cold drip coffee, and Campari (photo: http://bit.ly/2kIPwUh). It reminded me of my post-adolescence when we used to mix Kahlua and coffee at the Peppermill before prom. You'll be happy to know we didn't go for a third round given the debacle that recently occurred to us when we downed three chocolate mint kiss martinis in a row at Blondie's. It wasn't pretty though I thought I was, and that was only the beginning of the delusions. No, we left with a nice tropical buzz.

COCKTAILS - 4 stars...creative upscale cocktails in a non-tiki setting
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...really no different than most of the hipster-focused bars in town
SERVICE - 4 stars...a mostly quietly effective bar staff
TOTAL - 4 stars...the Pacific feels far away
author: Ed U.

description: Good place for drinks. Bit loud of a vibe but nicely tucked away from the hustle of downtown. Located conveniently above Union Square. Large selection of drinks and fun creative drinks. Get the pandan!
author: Royal B.

description:
I've been exploring the cocktail scene in San Francisco for awhile now and this is currently my favorite bar to go to at the moment. It's a mix of tiki and artisinal cocktail mixes.

 Very unique flavor profiles that please my Filipino palate. The drinks I had were the Manila Killa that has kalamansi juice, bitters, coconut, absinthe, and I believe scotch or cognac. Taste: sweet from the coconut and a little citrusy. Mouthfeel: creamy, and cold. The other drink I got was called a Pootie Tang (my new favorite word by the way). When I was ordering this drink I couldn't stop laughing because I kept saying Pootie Taaaahhhhhng. This drink contained pineapple infuse cognac, bitters, and sake. Taste: real harsh taste in the beginning, but suddenly disappears. No after taste left behind. Mouthfeel: typical liquid cocktail.

Going to make it a stop when I go into the City.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Tucked away amidst the big hotels and shops is this narrow space that serves great drinks in a cozy setting.  We went after dinner on a Sunday night so it wasn't crowded, but it was still buzzing a bit, but in a relaxed way -- friends catching up, couples on a date night, and everyone seemed nice and friendly -- not the hipsters or after-work crowd that you have to sometimes share a banquette with, and their conversations are just cringe-worthy.  I had the Thrilla in Manila which was delicious, but everyone in my party had cocktails that were equally as good.  I'd definitely go back!
author: Carlo A.

description:
Went on a Saturday night.

We were really excited at first because of the music - BBD and Bobby Brown - so a little throwback vibe.

There wasn't a DJ however and they didn't play old school R&B all night. It's actually just a playlist of songs from all genres.

Cocktails were good. The Jeepney was inventive and a shoutout to Jeepney in NYC that also serves bespoke creative cocktails.

We found a high-top table to the side and had a couple other cocktails. 

I like how this place is small. And next to our hotel.

Crowd was truly mixed. 

I recommend this place especially for small celebrations as there's a nice area in the back that a group can take over.
author: Ray M.

description: This was disappointing. The drinks look better than they taste. The bartender seemed annoyed when I asked what drinks he was preparing.
author: Glorimar A.

description: This small but upscale bar features bartenders who really know what they're doing. There aren't many seats at the bar and the front of PCH can get pretty crowded, but there is additional seating towards the back. The cocktails are creative and delicious!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I was here for Miracle, the pop up Christmas themed bar hosted by PCH. Decorations and holiday spirit was definitely top notch. The place looked incredible decked out in lights, snow, and Christmas cheer.

A bunch of rotating cocktails were available. My favorite was the Egg Nog. Nothing too special about the drinks though, they are merely okay.

Come here with a bunch of friends, but make sure everyone is on time because they are busy, especially on weekends. The bar is relatively narrow and small.
author: Henry Z.

description: Place was chill and had some very interesting drinks. Service was awesome and and the bartenders knew exactly how to describe the drinks. Their cocktail menu was awesome and they had some very catchy names for some of the drinks. I kept trying different cocktails and loved all of it. I would definitely come back and try more of their drinks!
author: Jenry R.

description: Delicious drinks. Definitely worth coming here. Good atmosphere. Laid back, dark ambiance. Drink quality is excellent.
author: Warren S.

description: Great place for a drink. Interesting menu. Nice staff. Went with the sparkling wine - mercat cava. Not overly sweet and very good. Place gets very crowded.
author: Linda H.

description:
Spent the whole evening sobbing at the bar and the service was magnificent! Awesome cocktails and a very nice atmosphere.
Highly recommended if you're looking for a nice evening alone.
author: Asaf N.

description:
A tinnnyyyyy spot for cocktails in the hustle and bustle of it all in SF. 

We popped in on a Wednesday evening around 7pm for a quick round with some friends who were visiting from out of town. Their specialty cocktails were interesting and pretty tasty, but expect to pay between $14-$18 depending on your drink of choice. 

I can imagine this place gets crowded on the busy nights and there isn't too much seating to begin with. 

Overall a hip spot to grab a drink in the area.
author: Siobhan F.

description:
Delicious cocktails and exciting ambience. 

Came here with friends for after-dinner drink around 8pm on a Saturday night and the bar is already semi-crowded, only few tables were left in the back of the bar. Menu has wide varieties of cocktails with different liquor base. I was able to sample 5 different cocktails and all of them are good. I ordered the swizzler and it came with a huge tall glass. It was dazzled with a dried pineapple on the top of the glass and it's refreshing and vey tropical flavor.  My least favorite of the night is probably the whiskey highball among the 5 drinks I tried. But they do have happy hour everyday before 7pm for the highball if you just want to grab a quick drink after work. 

Would definitely come again and look forward to trying more cocktails.
author: Erica H.

description:
Gotta adore the bustling ambiance and the innovative, artfully crafted libations from PCH! Shoutout to my girl, Janice C., for introducing me to this chill, brick wall neighborhood bar. 

During my visit, I tried their tropical Saffron, a savory and herbal saffron infused Montelobos Mezcal and Campari, with grilled pineapple. 

I love me a good extra Dirty Martini and here, they execute this classic well.

I'll definitely be back to check out the rest of the menu!
author: Merica S.

description:
Haven: a place of safety or refuge. This is definitely a nice haven from the busy work week, but the sound levels (as is the case with every other bar) leave something to be desired

Stopped by Friday night for a quick cocktail. There's a larger area in the back for seating-- the bar is at the front. The servers do come by and take drink orders, but don't check on you super often. 

There is clearly a good amount of work that's been put into the cocktails, with inventive ingredients such as salted pistachio and coconut lychee milk. Drinks weren't super strong, as evidenced by my non-tipsiness after drinking one (because let's face it, I'm a lightweight). They also weren't too sweet, which I liked. Creative names like Manila Sunshine were appreciated. 

They also have giant glasses (we're talking like 2 feet tall) of drinks that you can get to share with friends-- probably cost effective? or also may just induce your group to drink more....

Not sure I'd call the place classy since it's kind of small, but it's well decorated and nice inside. Not too dark either, which is nice.
author: Nicole H.

description:
It was my first time here, but it won't be my last! After a late dinner, we were wandering around the area and stumbled onto this place. The first thing you walk into is the well-stocked bar with seats that leads onto another large and dark seating area which is kind of shabby looking. A ramp leads to the questionable bathroom. There's also a set of stairs that leads down to another area, but it was closed off, so we'll be back to check it out. There's a yellow neon P.C.H. sign, and the rest is typical SF bar decor. The ambiance is lively with a younger crowd.

The menu is large with cheesy puns for cocktail names. They also have a few specials on the board. All the cocktails sound like they have too many ingredients, but they're actually pretty amazing and are designed well. We tried the Lime in the Coconut, Kung Fu Pandan, and some Kavalan. The cocktails take a while to make, but they're truly a labor of love. The bartenders are seasoned and professional in demeanor. 

The cocktails were well balanced - you could very subtly taste the base alcohol while well-placed accents danced around with every sip. The coconut drink was finished off with lime zest and coconut shavings that smelled refreshing as you sipped. The pandan drink was slightly salty and sweet with a delicate flavor of burnt pandan. I eyed some Kavalan on the top shelf, so asked for a makeshift flight to try the sherry and bourbon for $12 a pour.

Average drink price is around $14, but well worth it for the quality ingredients and expert execution. Would definitely go back - Cheers!
author: Farhan K.

description: The drink options all sound delicious! I got the lime in the coconut and it was delicious!! My friends got the stop and smell the rose- and I did not like it. It was too sweet. I definitely recommend the lime in da coconut.
author: Kim P.

description:
Pacific cocktail haven, indeed!

Fun names to their drinks!  I ordered up their Ko Olina Swizzle that was tropical and a looker.

The ambiance to the place is dimly lit and passive flying birds are patterns of their beige wallpaper in the back.

It's surely for the lovers of crafted cocktails.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
PCH (as the sign above the entrance and the retro neon lighting inside call it) is a really cool, laid-back cocktail bar that's on a quiet stretch of Sutter. Rolling in on the weekend on the early side (6-7 PM) meant that getting a seat either at the bar or in the back at a high-top table was a cinch. The bartenders here are very friendly and know their craft, as evidenced by the skill they showed in making my wife's mocktails. The front has high ceilings, giving it a spacious feel, while the back has low lighting, lower ceilings, and a bit more of an intimate ambiance. I also liked the contrast of the walls of the narrow cocktail bar - one side is old-school exposed brick, with shelves of liquor lined up at the bar, while the other has what looks like simple Chinese-style light watercolor paintings of mountains, although a closer look reveals a some subtle maps (of the U.S.?) laid underneath the outline of the mountains. It gives the spot a bit of a zen vibe, which I really liked.

As for the offerings here, I don't think food is offered - I didn't see it on the menu, nor did I see anyone eating any. However, there are a lot of cocktail offerings, presented in a slightly worn leather covering and laid out by liquor type. All the ones I had (which were 4 or 5 different ones) were quite good, although I will say my favorite was my first - Hall Pass, which was a robust vodka-based drink with a decent amount of citrus and a very nice thick layer of egg white foam on top. I also enjoyed the Hot Toddy - warm and soothing and quite perfect a drink for the winter. There are a few beers on tap (I didn't bother with those), and you can have cocktails made on demand - although I found you had better luck if you were at the bar talking to the bartenders directly as opposed to the waiters, who didn't have the same level of patience.

In all, I really enjoyed how casual the vibe was, and given the quality of the cocktails, I thought the prices were quite reasonable (particularly compared to NYC). Definitely a spot that I am going to hit up again next time I am in town!
author: Asuka N.

description: PCH is a wonderful cocktail bar in an old industrial building complete with brick walls and steel beams - perfect for a date or catching up with friends. we got the saffron which was a smoky mezcal drink cut with citrus and saffron notes ($12) there is no food on site but they have an agreement with hogwash next door and you can order food there and they will deliver to you at the bar. the staff was friendly and attentive, will be back!
author: Alexandra K.

description:
Love this cute little bar located in downtown SF!

Came here one night with my friends, and I can't wait to come back. They have an amazing amount of hand crafted cocktails that taste amazing! We each ordered a different drink, and rotated around the circle, and every one of those drinks tastes amazing. 

Price of drink is a bit over priced, and the inside is quite small. We had to wait a while to get a table for a group of 6 of my friends.
author: Cindy D.

description:
The parking in the area was better than expected. My friend and I both got good spots. Granted, we came around 9 PM. 

I am not sure that the drinks are as well made as they are attractive. The ambiance is okay, not too memorable. No cool vibe, btwn the setup and the music volume. 

I might return for cocktails just because they're pretty.
author: Paulina F.

description:
I love grabbing a few happy hour drinks with coworkers or friends after work to treat ourselves. I happened to be in the city and my friend came across this bar on Yelp. With such glowing reviews, we had to try the drinks out.

Before I begin, DEFINITELY TRY THE OH SNAP! 
As someone who's not a big fan of the taste of hard alcohol, this bar's drinks are incredible. They taste high quality, refreshing, and gourmet. Their menu is unique, has drinks such as the miso old fashion, which my friend enjoyed a lot (if you're a whiskey kind of person). The bartenders are also extremely nice as well. 

I recommend coming to this place. Yes, it can get busy, but it's worth the trip!
author: Joyce L.

description:
I get attached to my bartenders.

BIG TIME.

My cocktail loving heart broke with Josh's departure from Burritt Room and I found myself needing an "in-between" while I heal myself and lick my wounds.

Except Pacific Cocktail Haven has too much of a golden heart to be an in-between. It deserves love and loyalty and I'm happy to say that it's converted me to become a regular. 

If you've been a follower of the big man Kevin Deidrich, you'll know that this man has not only been a pioneer in SF's cocktail scene, he's been instrumental in setting the scene. He's also been credited to having inventive cocktails at several hotel bars he's previously worked at and even got featured on the Wall Street Journal (oddly enough, not for his bartending skills but for his workout routine!) True to his style, he tends to experiment with less sweet, more complex flavors that really tickles your curiosity. Although, PCH being a tiki-haven, some sweeter style concoctions are on the menu too. 

I consider myself a well-researched cocktail aficionado and in my years of cocktailing, you can say, I've seen it all. My palate is now looking for something new, exciting and different. PCH's menu gives me the junkie fix that I've never had before!

Drinks are fun and approachable, like the Lime in da Coconut (salted pistachio! coconut-lychee milk) and the Ko'Olina Swizzle with its orgeat and pineapple notes. This is a tall drink and it's not shy on the rum either!

There's also geek out cocktails like the Miso Old Fashioned that serious cocktailians will love. It has Miso-butter infused Bacardi 8 rum combined with Pommeau and bitters. It's savory and the surprising creaminess of the faint butter flavor will astound you. If that doesn't, then the proprietary "PCH" large ice cube will. Or for the more classic drinkers, their Bobby Burns and Martinis come with a little sidecar, it's like getting two drinks for the price of one!

The more adventurous should like OH Snap! which highlights sugar snap peas as the main ingredient. (Mom always told you to increase your vegetable intake, right?) or the very aesthetically pleasing Santorini Summer made with gin, cucumber, yogurt liquor and housemade tzatziki sauce. YES. You read that right! the only thing missing is a pita bread ... 

Now that I've given you a thorough breakdown of the menu, it's time to focus on how they treat customers here. Whether you come in two's or in a big group, you wouldn't need to fret. They lavished our group with the utmost service: recommending, entertaining and checking up on us. Do you want to bring food? no problem! you can order at Hogwash next door or bring your own. (I HIGHLY recommend Milan Pizza for serious drunk eats! ;-) 

Those long work weeks when I have to pull double shifts or work a 7 day stretch and all I want is to go to a neighborhood bar where I won't be ignored for 20 minutes --- I come here. The staff KNOWS that hospitality earns a customer's trust much faster than putting a cold bevvy in my hand.

That sole reason is why I'm now attached to my bartenders here. And when I get attached, it's for life.

* 2000th Review *
author: Janice C.

description: Yum yum yummy are the drinks! A little loud, but good vibes and cocktails. The owner is really nice. Check out the secret menu in blacklight. Ask bartenders for a blacklight to see it.
author: Gina R.

description: Went to their Christmas pop up and it was awesome! It looked like Christmas threw up in the bar. All cocktails were served in different holiday cups. There was a long line to wait in though. I'd like to go back when it's not a holiday bar to check it out. The holiday drinks were great so I'm sure the regular menu is awesome too.  Very close to downtown.
author: Makenzi B.

description:
Met a friend here for drinks after work. A small, but open space with a great vibe. The bartenders took the time to make good drinks and also the waiter was very kind and helpful in explaining the cocktails I would be most interested in. 

They have a good variety of drinks pending on which spirit you would want and they are open to suggesting what drink may be right for you.
author: Bori B.

description: I like this bar a lot. They have a great selections of drinks and a cool vibe. I came here with a group of 5 on a Friday night and the place was pretty full. We were able to snag a table towards the back and all tried a few different drinks. I had the Saffron (a mezcal drink that I highly recommend) and Ko'Olina swizzle, which was also pretty good. I'd love to come back to this place soon!
author: Andrew L.

description: The bartenders are super kind and generous geniuses, masters of mixology, and cocktail superheroes! I can't say enough great things about this amazing place. It's a must go for the Bay Area libation seeker.
author: Ahsan A.

description: Most amazing cocktails and very cool ambiance! I definitely recommend checking this place out!!!
author: Lisa V.

description: We were on vacation in San Francisco and stumbled across this place. The drinks are the best! Not only to they look great they taste amazing! Love the atmosphere and the bartenders were great!
author: Vanessa C.

description: Came back here a second time. They had the Kung fu pandan, which was pretty good. They should make this a permanent menu item! Also, happy hour ends at 7pm here.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Great service.  Great drinks.  Handsome bartenders!

I noticed that the exposed brick walls held a collection of cocktail books along with various liquors.  Their concoctions are original, inspired and proof that this place loves what it does.
"Pineapple" is a theme that presents itself everywhere.   Multiple brass pineapples sit on the shelving along with the bottles.  It's also part of their logo.

It's a friendly bar--the bartenders will engage with you. And, it's a nice change of pace as it is also pretty mellow.  The clientele tonight was a professional mix of locals out for the evening looking for a craft cocktail.  I tried a Blinker tonight--rye, raspberry, grapefruit.  Excellent taste and has a kick too!

Definitely worth checking out if you want to drop out of the hustle/bustle of Union Square when you are there.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Pretty cool place. It's small but there's plenty of seating. They have some crazy cocktails to try, with groovy glasswear. One was served in a wood cup with a lid, the wine was in a cute straight glass, my beer was in a cold stein. The menu is arranged by spirit (whiskey page, gin page etc). Each drink sounds normal enough, but then as you read the ingredients there's one in every entry that makes you say whaaa? 
The atmosphere is very chill. The servers are polite and patient, it's dimly lit but is good for groups. I'd go back.
author: Lindsey P.

description:
Stopped by here for a drink with a friend. Walking in, the ambiance was awesome - trendy and laid back with lower lighting. They also have a couch and other seating in the back, a nice area for a relaxing time! I was very excited to try the drink called Lime in Da Coconut after looking at photos and reading through other reviews. I was so glad I got this drink because it was delicious although on the sweeter side. It tastes exactly as the name suggests! My friend got a Miso old-fashioned, it was very smooth but we couldn't really taste anything specific that was different.

Chatting with the bartenders helped to make my time more enjoyable. They were friendly and were open to talking about the multiple types of alcohol they offer and the differences between the brands. It was awesome to learn about new brands I haven't heard of.

Definitely a nice place to get a nicely made drink in a relaxing atmosphere.
author: Katherine L.

description:
"Your friendly neighborhood bar" is what how the website greets you. An understatement. 

From the welcoming and accommodating service (bring your own food, or order from Hogwash next door) to the exquisite, ever-changing cocktail menu, this place is the new hot spot in San Francisco. 

The drinks are creative and fairly priced ($12-$15). My favorites: the spicy Swizzle My Nizzle (Olmeca Altos Blanco Tequila, passion fruit, vanilla, lime, habanero bitters, $13) and the amazingly fresh Ko'olina Swizzle (Banks 7 Rum, Banks 5 Rum, banana, orgeat, pineapple, bitters, $13). I do like my drinks on the sweeter side, but there are plenty of other options on the menu.

Cocktail lovers stop by - this is a great spot.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Absolutely loved this cocktail bar near Union Square. My friend randomly chose this place (first time for both of us!) because it was in a convenient location - such a great find! Atmosphere was chic, service was greaaaaattt, and they have a seriously impressive collection of liquor. My friend has high whiskey standards, and he kept making comments about the rare options they had.

We came on a Saturday around 5:30pm. They have happy hour everyday from 5-7pm, even on the weekends! HH is $10 for the cocktails on their HH list. There were many open seats at the bar and in the back at that time; after ~1.5 hours, around 7pm or so, the bar started getting pretty packed.

My friend asked for a cocktail with egg whites, and the bartender immediately made him something delicious off-menu. Later, we asked for bourbon old fashions, instead of the miso one, and there was absolutely no hesitation. Great service! The one drink I personally didn't enjoy was the Lime in Da Coconut because it was too sweet for me. If that's your style though, I'm sure it's delicious.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Tanisha S.

description: Ok. For cocktail lovers out there, PCH is a must.  The mixologist (I wouldn't dare call him simply a bartender) was passionate, intelligent, and an artist. If I had a better tolerance, I would have stayed their all day. We walking in to an empty place right when it opened, 5 pm, to the smell of roasted pineapples. The bar was full next time I looked up and the drinks were amazing and beautiful. The second drink had mushroom dust (no not the magical kind) and pan dam (spelling?).  The combination and the perfume alone made me think about drinks differently. I could right more but I'd rather spend my time driving there to get another drink. (Attached are a few photos which don't do the drinks or atmosphere justice.)
author: Don O.

description:
The art in the cocktails drew me to PCH. The drinks are so pretty. Didn't even want to drink it but it's alcohol and you can not waste alcohol. I got the Ko'Olina Swizzle, under the RUM page. It was delicious!! My friend got the Coconut in the Lime with Vodka, so good too. About $12-$16 dollars on most cocktails, pricier but so worth it. 

I think I might like this place more than Local Edition. As for the decor, rustic look towards the back. Paintings on one side of the wall and black bricks on the other. Small but good amount of seating.
author: Sandy B.

description: Good drinks, small place, nice vibe, but a little pricey. Came in on a Tuesday night and it wasn't crowded but not dead so a good place to grab a drink anh night of the week and be able to get a seat.
author: Saleem E.

description: Came here with my friends on a Thursday night in the city. We were barhopping and decided to stop by this place. When we came here, there were no seats available, the place is quite cozy. No security carded us at the door, so anyone can go in, however if you chose to order a drink they will card you. You find your own table, no one seats you. We wandered around and there were no seats so we were ready to leave, however a table just wrapped up and we took over the seating. Drinks are typical SF prices, especially located in the heart of downtown, this appeals to tourists. I didn't think this place was super interesting or special when it came into the interior decor and design. The drinks were separated on the menu based off of liquor. For example, one page would be vodka based drinks, whereas the next were rum based. Overall, our party of 5 people, we didn't feel anything special about the drinks. It was one of those, oh we're in the city, let's go try it on time kind of places. Nothing that convinced me to return again. Service was mediocre, order drinks, bring drinks, that was pretty much about it. Parking is hard to find, so be prepared to shop around for a spot.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Thanks to Janice C, I finally went to Pacific Cocktail Haven! A group of us got together last Friday, July 22nd around 8:15pm. It was pretty packed so we started out at one of the barrel tables to the left of the back. After we got our first round, a table opened up in the back and we finally had a place to sit down.

*Bobby burns: cutty sark prohibition scotch, sweet vermouth, benedictine, bitters ($12)
*Blinker: wild turkey rye, raspberry, grapefruit ($12)
*Saffron: saffron infused montelobos mezcal, campari, grilled pineapple, citrus ($13)

I got the Bobby Burns. A little reminiscent of a manhattan which I adore. The drink was actually lighter than I thought it would be, but I do like my drinks stiff. I am a scotch neat girl after all. Later for our second round, a one of us ordered a Sake drink and I asked for a special Whiskey special cocktail. This was more my style as it was nice and boozy.

Super fun atmosphere. I've been to Cantina several times, but PCH has a sexier feel. The space is more or less the same, but I loved the vibe. Busy, but it feels a little more intimate. Nice lounge feel.
