Their cocktail menu is extensive, so I can't wait to go back and try more drinks. Or even ask for another specialty cocktail. I did enjoy that last one. I'm already thirsty just thinking about it!
author: Elena N.

description: Right off of Union Square, this bar is a classy and fun place to spend happy hour. We came in on a Wednesday afternoon to find all the seats at the bar full, so we sat in the back booth. Our waiter was friendly and helpful in answering questions we had about the extensive PCH drinks menu. The menu itself was well designed, listing the beverages by liquor type and showing elegant drawings of the drinks. The first drink I ordered was delicious, and the Pimm's we ordered was fantastic. The drinks here are a nice size and are strong without tasting strong (so basically, they're super yummy). Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area and need some down time.
author: Alexis C.

description: I love their Holiday/seasonal drinks! Everything I tried has been absolutely delicious, and wish Christmas would never end so I could keep coming by to try new drinks. My favorite by far is the "Kung Fu Pandan" drink which isn't in their menu, but listed as a special on their board. It's light, refreshing, and has a slight taste of savory pandan flavor. It gets super crowded though so be sure to come early (5pm?) or late (9pm!) to avoid the crowd.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
oh, PCH where have you been my whole life?
PCH has been on my radar since it's opening a few months ago. My bartender friends were visiting from the east coast and we were able to stop in for some pre-flight cocktails recently before they had to leave. 

Entering in, PCH is relatively small. A little table in the window, long bar and some seating in the back area. I can see why this place is poppin for happy hours, luckily we got there early and were able to snag some seats.  The bartender immediately came over to greet us and hand us some menus to look over.  The menu is extensive and well organized. Each page has a different spirit base and a little something for everyone. Drinks are priced around $13+ which I think is pretty average for the quality of ingredients you are getting here. We had the following drinks: Swizzle My Nizzle, Saffron, Ko'Olina Swizzle, and Bay Bridge Buck. Each cocktail was perfectly balanced, tons of flavor and strongggg. 

If only my wallet would let me I would come here on the reg. But, for now, PCH is a great spot to come to enjoy a high quality deliciously made drink and a great addition to the neighborhood. cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Talk about being the new hot spot! I've been getting this place and Pagan Idol confused for weeks. Just stopped by here for after dinner drinks after a double date. 

Walked in around midnight Friday and was scared there wouldn't be a seat. It was pretty packed but luckily this bar has a pretty large space once you get past the initial bar area. We managed to be right on time to take over the entire back lounge seats so we could feel like pseudo ballers sitting in the back of a club. 

The menu is extensive and can be overwhelming. The drinks are categorized by alcohol type and they serve giant fountain sized ones for large parties. I got the rum version of the fo shizzle my nizzle or something. Wait it was the Ko'Olina Swizzle. It was huge but think it was mostly crushed ice. All the drinks were pretty good. My friend's drink was oddly spicy and I wasn't into it but she loved it! 

Ran about $60 for four drinks which is not horrible. Music is pretty loud and it was really hot in the bar. It would've been nicer if they played reggae or something to go with the theme but Top 40 it is.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
PCH is an awesome spot to come for drinks in the Lower Nob Hill. Convenient to Union Square,  they have a huge selection at the bar. However, this place has a limited cocktail menu, with 3-4 drinks per alcohol. The cocktails on the menu each look fantastic, and I've had a couple during my limited stay in the area. The Eastern promises is an interesting asian fusion drink, and you can definitely taste the spice in it. The Oh Snap was also delicious. The barkeeps and the service here was also great, though admittedly I did not come during rush hour.

If your going to be in the area the PCH is definitely a goto spot to get drinks and hang out.
author: Leon K.

description: Such nice atmosphere and great drinks. The vibe is as if you are drinking with your close friends at home. Cool people and very attentive mixologists. I ordered three different drinks and had a couple of sips from my friends and they were all almost perfect... definitely suggest this place.
author: Rou B.

description:
I'm a cocktail snob who just went to PCH for the first time - and it's already my fav cocktail bar in the city. cocktails were amazing, creative, and had a great variety - especially if you're familiar enough with cocktails to see how they stand out. I hadn't realized the menu was south east asian inspired - which leant everything some really fresh flavors.

service was great. we came on a saturday afternoon, easily seated, and got table service. our server was sweet and helpful!

thrilla from manila, rappers delight, and pootie tang were all shockingly excellent. banana stand was great too, but maybe a step down.
thrilla from manila had sooo much flavor - and reads as very tropical. i might have had a hard time guessing it was a whisky cocktail if i didn't know.
rappers delight was super flavorful too - it was especially well balanced for a scotch cocktail, with tropical and salty flavors.
pootie tang was elegant, floral, nicely boozy.
banana stand was a nice whisky cocktail, and the kaluha and sherry blended with each other really nicely, but even though the flavors were unique somehow it tasted closer to other whisky cocktails i've had.

GOING BACK SO SOON
author: Rachel M.

description:
Since moving out of the bay area 5+ years ago, I have found that I am nowhere near as hip as I used to be, and that I am far more east coast than west coast at this point.

However, when a gorgeous friend wants to go out for cocktails, and is an expert in that area, you go where he tells you to.

The good:

The cocktails, naturally.  I had the Swizzle My Nizzle and Pootie Tang, because why shouldn't I pick my beverages based on their names?  Both were expertly crafted and delicious, although I much prefer the Swizzle over the Pootie.

We sat at the bar and there is a lot to look at- I'm particularly enamored with the Star Wars tiki mugs, although there are others to covet if you're interested.

The bad:

For two people sitting at the bar, one of whom is well known in the cocktail industry, the service was...lacking.  It's clear that the set of bartenders are the under-30 set who have not yet mastered the art of growing a loyal guest base by utilizing excellent customer service.  I get that it is relatively near to touristy places and at roughly a billion dollars a drink, that's all they may get, but seriously, why not?

Bonus points for the guy who came in with some sort of wrestling champion belt.  Still don't know who he is.
author: Pam S.

description:
I had been wanting to check this place out the next time I was in the area. My cousin and I got to PCH about 15 minutes just after it opened on a Saturday evening. We walked right by it at first, as it's easy to miss. There were a few patrons already in the bar, but it was fairly empty. That was the idea anyways, for us to get there early before the crowds that a Saturday evening can bring. We were able to grab a seat right at the middle of the bar. 

I'm a whiskey/bourbon drinker, so I went for the Ward Eight, which had Wild Turkey in it I believe. The drink was amazing! Probably one of the best cocktails I've ever had, no joke! I ordered my cousin the Cowfee Twalk. She enjoyed that as well! Tasted like coffee as one might imagine! 

I finished off with the Miso Old Fashion. It was a little different than what I'm use to drinking when I drink Old Fashions but it tasted pretty good! It tasted like a lemon cough drop but in a good way! 

We hung out for about about an hour or so and the bartenders were very attentive and I don't remember the bartenders name who made my drinks, but he was very informative about the drinks and kept checking on us. We even share a love for Rye Whiskey's so he showed me one of his favorites that he thought I should try. 

Overall it was a great experience and the drinks are top notch! I actually prefer little places like this and the overall vibe. It's a very welcoming cocktail bar that I will definitely be coming back to!
author: Anthony L.

description:
If you're looking for a place to grab an extraordinary cocktail and catch up with a friend, this place is for you! Definitely get the $13 "Lime in da Coconut" with reyka vodka, salted pistachio, coconut-lychee milk, and citrus. How good does that sound?! I kid you not, it's actually as good as it sounds. It's delicious, but extremely dangerous because you'd want another one right away..

Additionally, there are plenty of comfortable seating areas. They don't serve food, but you can order food next door (or anywhere else) and bring it in! I can't speak from experience, but I saw someone eating a burger at the bar and asked the employees ;D
author: Jenny H.

description: So happy my co-worker recommended this place. I came here with a girl friend on a Wednesday night and we were both impressed by the unique drinks menu and the variety of drinks. They have a lot of Asian-inspired flavors like pandan, which you don't see too often. Being from Southeast Asia, my eyes and tastebuds naturally gravitated towards the Asian drinks. I got the "Lime in da coconut" which was dangerously delicious. There were so many other drinks I wanted to try and I'll definitely be back. Since this is so close to work, this might become a regular thing!
author: Joan S.

description: This place is bomb. Their have a big cocktail menu and the drinks are pretty good. They have a nice casual lounge type of seating beside the bar section which is nicely lit up. They are not as good as Trick dogs in Mission, but they are still good.
author: Ash M.

description: The venue is cool but the drinks are loaded with sugar. Had a sip of three different cocktails and couldn't stand them. We asked for something that wasn't too sweet as well.
author: Kartik S.

description: every drink is delicious, ya won't regret it. Get the one with the candy cap dust, tastes like fancy af mushrooms but is still bomb
author: Melody E.

description: New favorite cocktail bar. These people are def mixologists!! The server was so friendly and attentive and the atmosphere and music is awesome. I loveeeeeee this place !
author: Sandy C.

description: this was my second time coming here without realizing that i've been here before! i came here about 2 years ago and really enjoyed the drinks. this time i ordered from their charity events drink menu and thought my drink tasted like juice! i forgot the name of the drink but it didn't look as aesthetically pleasing as my other friends' drinks but it was okay haha. the second drink i got was a bell-pepper tequila drink? i felt like i was drinking vegetable juice but it was good! i just got a margarita for my last drink and i like how much they salted the rims of my drink lol. i will be coming back here again!
author: diane d.

description: Used to go here when it was Cantina's, but love the place now.  It's nicely lit up inside with a huge lounge area in the back.  Great selection of whiskies.  Not too crowded on a Saturday night.  Bartender, Francis, was very attentive.  Detailed when making drinks.  Not too loud, music was old school hip hop jams.  Mixed crowd.  Would definitely come back to PCH!
author: KB B.

description:
If you're going to charge $11-$13 for a cocktail, it'd better be good. I met up with one of my friends at PCH on a Saturday night and the place was packed. We couldn't get a table for over an hour, so we settled for the shelved wall near the bar. I ordered 3 cocktails from PCH and I absolutely loved each drink:

- Swizzle my Nizzle: tequila, passion fruit, vanilla, lime, habanero bitters
- Saffron: mezcal, Campari, grilled pineapple, citrus
- Bay Bridge Buck: Ketel One Citroen, strawberry-shrub citrus, egg white, ginger beer

The cocktails are strong, well made, and layered with flavor. The bartenders are also super friendly and give great drink recommendations if you're not sure what to try next. I look forward to coming back and trying more of their cocktails.
author: Helen P.

description: Amazing amazing team, excellent customer service! The drinks are so diverse, so many options on the menu with great descriptions. The ambiance and crowd is so chill. My husband and I came in on a Thursday night, and the music was perfect. Everything here has a unique, creative touch. Kevin, the owner, makes you feel at home and welcomed. We will definitely be regulars here. Soooo worth the 45 minute commute from our home!
author: Lecille P.

description: The best cocktail in the city!! This is my go to bar in the city no matter which of the town I am in! I brought many friends here and they also loved it! The atmosphere and the decor is on point!!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Cocktails, staff, service and vibe...AMAZING!!! Hands down one of the best (or THE best) bars in San Francisco. Had the Local Word and Pepitas Banditas recently and absolutely LOVED both drinks. Don't walk - RUN to P.C.H! Otherwise, you're missing out.
author: Kalani K.

description: Clearly the owner of this restaurant or the mixologist has ever heard of Snoop Dog. Otherwise they would never name one of their "exceptional drinks" the "Swizzle my Nizzle"! I'm offended reading/seeing it published in San Francisco Bay Area Where magazine. I will never patronize your business and other people of color shouldn't be doing so either. You might want to google what "nizzle" references in the urban dictionary. STAY WOKE!
author: Nhp C.

description:
I used to come here when they used to be Cantina. I didn't realize PCH opened here, but PCH's drinks are awesome. I wasn't sure if I would call it a tiki bar though since their menu has a lot more than just rum drinks. 

Each page of the menu focuses on a key type of spirit in your drink (i.e., whiskey, brandy, vodka, gin, etc.). They have really creative names for their drinks, and attention to detail is high as they even brand "PCH" on their ice. All the drinks I've had were delicious. Bartenders were friendly and drinks came out pretty fast. There are so many other drinks on their menu that I would try so I'll likely be coming back soon!
author: Rick T.

description: PCH has a great selection of craft cocktails! Lounge atmosphere and the prices are very reasonable for the types of drinks they are serving.
author: Robin H.

description:
PCH is an upscale bar minutes away from Union Square known for its snazzy cocktails.

We arrived around 5 PM on a Friday, beating the crowd by a couple of minutes. When you walk in, PCH seems a bit small, but as you pass the bar you walk into a much more open, roomy seating area perfect for couples and groups alike. 

Upon taking a seat, we were promptly greeted by a waiter and given our menus. The menus are organized with each page defined by spirit, and cocktails becoming less citrusy and stronger as you go down the page.

After a fair share of browsing and contemplating, I opted for the "Oh, Snap!" a super sweet and refreshing gin based cocktails coupled with sugar snapped peas. My friend opted for the Lime de Coconut which was a bit stronger but just as refreshing. Also, shout out to PCH for its cocktail/ice presentation. 

All in all, a great bar to splurge on some creative cocktails and get your fancy on.
author: Umeet S.

description:
Great music! Been exploring the city on my own and popped in here after a solo trip to the color factory! Loved the vibe and felt okay being alone-- if you are single and trying to find places that don't feel awkward to just hang out, this was it for me! 

Cocktails are expensive- as expected at a cocktail bar :) well worth the coins!
author: Leanne G.

description: Stumbled across PCH while on vacation, had just left Hogwash next door and was on the look out for a good cocktail.  We were lucky to find a spot at the bar and enjoyed a few rounds.  My hubby stuck to his favorite an old fashioned.  They had branded large ice cubes which I thought was a nice touch.  I'm not a big fan of old fashions but really liked the taste and craftsmanship here.  I asked for a custom drink based on flavors I liked and was pleasantly surprised each time.  Had a great time and was happy to have found this place.
author: Jessica M.

description: Delicious drinks!!! Try the pornstar cocktail!!! So good! Loved the ambience and bartenders were awesome too! They made sure to take care of you quick! If I'm ever back in SF will be sure to check them out again!
author: Duran D.

description:
There's not many places that win my heart instantly, but PCH definitely came at me with a swoop.

The bar is casual, but the drinks are delicious. I love the openess of the place and all the natural lighting. The drinks are well balanced with just enough complexity, not incredibly sweet like a typical tiki/tropical drink. Plenty of seating at the bar, so if you snag one you can watch the bartender to their thing, which I am a fan of people watching.

I think I found my go to spot afterwork!
author: Minh N.

description:
Came in around 5 for Happy Hour and left impressed!!
The atmosphere was great and the bar wasn't too crowded around that time!
Plenty of seating and cozy couches towards the back!
The drinks were out of the ordinary and both looked and tasted great!
Definitely worth checking out
author: Tejal G.

description:
I have probably been to PCH about 10 times, and I enjoy my drinks every single time. What gives this bar a one up on other craft cocktail bars, is that the bartenders are friendly (the ones I have dealt with anyways.) You tend to get snotty, or aloof bartenders at fancy cocktail bars, but that isn't the case here. The bartending staff can make or break a place for me, especially in a neighborhood bar. If I want to grab a drink by myself and sit at the bar, it's nice to deal with a friendly face, and that's what greets you here. 

The drink menu is obviously carefully thought out, and each drink is made with precision. My favorite, hands down, is the Ko'olina Swizzle. It reminds me of a mai tai, kind of. There are two kinds of rum in it, some banana flavor, pineapple, and a few other things. What kicks it up a notch is that it's presentation is really fun. It's served on crushed ice, with a dried pineapple slice and I think a pineapple leaf. And it isn't an overly sweet drink; it has a nice bang of liquor that will make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. Prices aren't cheap, but that's typical for craft cocktails in SF, or I guess anywhere. 

The atmosphere is cool, pretty laid back. They play pretty good music, and as the night goes on, it gets louder, making for a pretty fun environment.
author: Liz M.

description: Very nice low key bar with good drinks. Met up some friends, wasn't overcrowded, quick service from open to close, clean and very nice atmosphere.
author: David T.

description: I absolutely love all the cocktail options they have here!! There is a delicious coconut milk one in the vodka section that is to die for. I could drink 10 of those because they taste so good! I have yet to come with enough people to get a fish bowl, but I definitely need to try it. This place also has enough seating but at times it can get crowded.
author: Nicole Y.

description: Great cocktail bar. Somewhere in the middle between speakeasy and local dive bar, fancy drinks with super chill vibe. Came here for NYE and had some great craft cocktails. Service was great and prompt and our server was quick to recommend cocktails based on our likes. Great music, great service, great drinks. You can't go wrong here.
author: Sharon G.

description:
Thank you Pacific Cocktail Haven for making my friend's birthday a great one!  Janice C. chose this easy to miss gem for her birthday.  It's owned by the owners of Hogwash so if you need some eats to soak up the booze you can order some sausages from them and they'll bring it over.  

Bobby and Rodney were the first to get there to hold down the fort.  They told us one of the employees was so nice with helping us get a large seating area in the back for all of Janice's friends.  He was also helpful with helping me what to order.  While the Ko Olina drink caught my eye because I love pineapple, Janice told me that it's very strong, so ultimately I went with the Sherry Cobbler which is on the LBV (low alcohol by volume) page.  Drinks here are handcrafted and very creative with mixes of spices and herbs.  I loved my Sherry Cobbler - not to sweet, not too much herbs, and it was unique.  Prices are standard due to location.  Two drinks sent us back about $26.  Next time I'll get a little more ballsy and order something not on the LBV page.  ;). The guys were very sweet and presented Janice with a golden pineapple containing their boozy punch concoction.  They checked on us frequently and totally didn't mind us bringing in some outside pizza and cake.  

It's in a great location in the heart of Union Square on Sutter.  PCH I'll be back for more!
author: Cat C.

description:
Funniest story ever. My boyfriend and I had reservations for dinner close by so we had decided to grab drinks beforehand. Lo and behold there are a bunch of bars nearby and I just had him choose a few for us to get a few drinks at. He had chosen this place as our first stop. As we were sitting down, I got a text from Stefanie C. She and I are both avid Yelpers and love trying new spots, but for the most part only send each other spots if we're making plans to hang out. Randomly she sends me a text about a bar because it looked really cool. And it was the SAME bar I was ALREADY in. Anyways, I told her that; we laughed and I decided to put in my Yelp review. 

The drinks here were great. I'll admit I've been drinking less lately since trying to slim down without really working out means I have to cut calories. And the way to best so that is through drinking less.

I got this pineapple inspired drink and he ordered some old fashion inspired drink. Mine came in this cup that made the whole thing look like a pineapple which is super fun and his had a ice cube with the initials of the company on it (PCH). Drinks were delicious and glad we dropped by. 

Overall, great vibe and I wish we had a bit more time there. A little dark when you're not close the outside or under the skylight. The seats by the barrels weren't the most comfortable, but still pretty awesome. Great theming and presentation within the drink. 

Pro tip: pineapple!
author: Nina Y.

description:
came on a tuesday night around 10pm. it wasn't too crowded which was nice, and there was a good amount of seating between the bar and the back couches. the music was fairly loud, so it was a bit hard to talk and hear. 

i got an oh snap! at the recommendation of the bartender. i don't do well with mass amounts of alcohol nor do i like the taste of it, so he took that into consideration (with no judgement, which was much appreciated). it didn't taste that strong, nor did it affect me much, so that was nice. if you want your cocktail to taste like green juice, i'd recommend. otherwise, maybe not. definitely unique though.

my friend liked her moscow mule, which was super gingery and refreshing. my other friend also really liked the lime in da coconut, whose predominant flavors were lychee and coconut. mmm.

would recommend for unique cocktails in a casual setting, especially if you're looking for something low alcohol.
author: Heather F.

description: Normally I try to steer clear of Union Square because it's so touristy, but this is a hidden gem. As soon as you walk in the bartenders greet you with a genuine smile and hello. The ambiance is awesome; trendy with gold pineapples and dark colors, but not tacky. I got there around 4:30 on a Friday and it was pretty empty so I had my pick of the tables. By 5 it was completely packed though. I started with the oh snap! which was amazingly refreshing and almost too easy to drink. All their drinks looked really refreshing and tasty.
author: Sara T.

description:
Drinks:
The drink menu is minimalistic with different sections depending on the type of alcohol (which I think more bars should do, it makes it so simple to order!) All the drinks averaged around $13+, which is fair for a bar in San Francisco. I was able to try two of their drinks: 

Swizzle my Nizzle
Olmeca Altos Blanco Tequila, passion fruit, vanilla, lime, habanero bitters   13

Lime In Da Coconut
Vodka, salted pistachio, coconut-lychee milk, citrus   13

Swizzle my Nizzle was quite spicy, too spicy for my taste. I felt like the spice drown out every other flavor of the drink, it wasn't necessary terrible, but it wouldn't be my first choice if I were to come back. I did enjoy Lime In Da Coconut! It was super tropical and tasty, I could drink this stuff all day. If you're intro tropical, lighter tasting drinks, Lime In Da Coconut is the way to go. 

Service:
Because this bar isn't over the top packed (visited on a Friday night ~9pm), the bartenders are able to provide great service to everyone. Usually there's an uneven ratio between bartenders and customers but that's not the case at PCH. We were able to score seats at the bar and were promptly attended by the bartender. They were fast and efficient, but not chatty; they are there to make drinks! When our glasses were empty, they were prompt in offering the drink menu once more. 

Atmosphere:
PCH is on the smaller side, with only a couple of seats at the bar. They do also offer some seating towards the back and plenty of standing space. PCH offers a dimly light, trendy atmosphere. This spot would be ideal for a first date because it doesn't get crowded and it's not crazy loud. Only downside is that they share a bathroom with the bar next door...so be ready to wait in a line for the bathroom. Overall, PCH will be added to my list of bars. Def a great addition!
author: Stefany Z.

description:
I used to work for a guy whose management style was called MBA.

Management by walking around.  He would walk around the office, with no particular agenda in mind, but just to observe.

I applied that MBA style to one of my post work cocktail hunts, which lead me to PCH.  And what a find.  I just wished they had a whisky list so my poor eyes didn't have to strain to see what was lined up on the wall.
author: Ron L.

description:
Visited PCH with Sandy B. and we were both impressed by the delicate cocktaill art. The bar is small and we got there at a really good time (around 5:30pm). I always go for Vodka when out and about, this time the same; even I am usually not a fan of coconut, Coconut in Da Lime looks so delicious that I had to give it a try, and I'm so glad I did. 

I love how they have the drawings of the cocktails on the menu so I can kind of expect what it would look like. It's a little bit pricy but I will definitely come back again (:

2016040
author: Leslie C.

description: Fantastic drinks, friendly bartenders, conveniently walkable from union square. I'd recommend the pornstar martini!
author: Ryan G.

description:
*** In Short ***

Cozy cocktail lounge succeeding Cantina, with an extensive and varied drink list.

*** In Depth ***

Goodbyyye Cantina, helloooo PCH!

A lot of new bars have cropped up in downtown over the past few months, and, wanting to make sure headway through the ever-growing list of places I bookmarked, my friend and I made plans to check out PCH after work one day. Imagine my surprise when I show up, think to myself, "this place looks familiar," and then realize that what was once Cantina, had now become this new and spacious cocktail bar (Cantina patrons will remember how cramped the place was), with a far, far more extensive cocktail program, from the folks that also brought you Press Club.

Now, was I delighted or disappointed by this development? As far as the venue itself goes, I much preferred the new layout at PCH: clean, slick, and again, most importantly, more spacious than her predecessor. And for those who like variety, PCH's liquor-specific cocktail menu is nothing to shake your finger at. But (and I know y'all expected a but), the couple drinks that my friend and I had all had a rather floral aftertaste to them: as she put it, more plainly, "their drinks all remind me of potpourri." An unfortunate association, to say the least.

That said, the drinks weren't bad, and there are certainly enough of them that I'll reserve further judgement for a future visit.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - As with most bars, you'll find a large percentage of the seating here to either be bar counter seating, other high tops, or a lot of standing areas with high top level counters for drink placement. I can't recall if they had standard height tables, but my friend and I found ourselves by the front bench instead, people watching.

Bathroom - Didn't use them, but assuming they're the same as Cantina's, they should be accessible.
author: Johnny W.

description:
SO GOOD.

Sorry trick dog, but another cocktail lounge has stolen my heart. I'm so impressed by SF's cocktail scene as it stands but like WOW. This takes the cake in terms of quality, creativity, and selection. I wanted to order everything off the menu. Prices are sort of steep $13 and the setting feels really cramped, which I don't like but it's SF so ... 

You can order food from Hogwash next door if you choose!
author: Cindy W.

description:
Ooooo I will definitely make more appearances here! I stopped by here with a friend after she got off work to hang out a bit and catch up on a Wednesday around 6pm. The place had an adequate amount of people and all the tables in the back were taken, but there was still plenty of standing room and a couple seats at the bar. Bartenders were very attentive and friendly also :) 

The menu is separated by the spirit used--each page consists of 2-3 cocktails of that spirit listed--super easy to find out what you want/prefer. 

What we got: 
1) Swizzle my Nizzle: mmm this was spicy and sweet at the same time. This drink came at the suggestion of Miguel, our bartender, and it didn't disappoint! I'd definitely try this one out again. 
2) Bay Bridge Buck: This was probably my favorite--it tasted like a strawberry lemonade. It didn't taste dangerous but I'm sure it was!
3) Lime in da Coconut: really tasty for those wanting something a bit more tropical with a hint of lime. 

The vibe was pretty chill, got a bit more busy as 7:30-8pm rolled around, but still wasn't overly crowded where it became annoying or too loud. I'll definitely be back!
author: Shannon N.

description: Just had some great cocktails made by Francis our bar tender...asked him to do off the menu a spicy grapefruit Margarita ..not so spicy but great flavor ..
author: Peggy G.

description: I've been passing by this establishment since I arrived six weeks ago. I finally stopped by. Drinks are A+++ and the staff is even better...and great to look at. #ImMarriedThough
author: Ashley D.

description:
Love, Love, Love the drinks. 

It was one of those weeks where I ended up at what seemed like almost the same place each day. It made comparing very easy and Pacific Cocktail Haven is the winner in my book. We met for drinks right after work on Friday and I had such a fun time reading the names and descriptions on the cocktail menu.

I started with a Lime in da Coconut, which is one of the tastiest drinks I've ever had. I would like to clarify, though, that I absolutely love coconut milk and that was the star of this cocktail. The drinks are beautifully designed, meticulously crafted, and served in the perfect vessels. For drinks with big ice cubes, they even brand the PCH logo into the ice. How cool is that?

As we sat there sipping our drinks, I noticed that some people got drinks with metal straws. Maybe I was tipsy but I had straw envy. When I tried a new drink, Swizzle My Nizzle, my date ordered it with a metal straw. I was so happy. The drink was so pretty that I didn't want to ruin it.

PCH is a great addition to the SF cocktail bar scene. The drinks here are original and delicious and the bartenders are friendly. Highly recommended!
author: Yi Z.

description:
Another must visit spot. If you're into cocktails you must come here as the drink selection here is phenomenal. Super hip and young you'll find young professionals as well as hipsters from all across the spectrum. prices are standard but hey we pay that for a good cocktail anywhere in San Francisco. Rum heavy and if you go up a big group of friends get one of their giant punch dispenser bowls for sharing. If you go that route, make sure you snag a table.  

Definitely another good places for bar hopping in FiDi/tenderloin
author: Diane T.

description:
If you're a fan of cocktail bars, you could walk into PCH and think "It's another cocktail bar, what's the big deal?"  Then my friend, look closer.

Look at the ice cubes.  They are perfectly clear. 
Look at the bar stations.  They are cleaner than some hospitals.  
Look at the glassware.  Every drink has it's own cup.

The attention to detail and organization is just the starting point.  Owner Kevin Diedrich uses  chronic OCD to his advantage.  The attention to detail doesn't just stop with the setting-  each of his award winning cocktails are carefully and expertly made by Diedrich or one of his very capable bartenders.  There's a cocktail for any mood, and any of the staff are happy to help you find the one that is right for you, either on or off the menu.  The staff is always going to go out of their way to make sure that you have a good experience.  If you're a fan of craft cocktails, then try to go in at a slow time to talk shop with the staff.  They are all very knowledgeable about spirits.  

Remember back ten years ago when you used to use Internet Explorer and didn't understand what the fuss was about this Firefox browser?  Then remember how you switched because your nerdy friend made you, and then a week later you realized that you could never go back?  Well, consider this review your new nerdy friend, and PCH is your new way to browse San Francisco cocktails.
author: Hiland H.

description:
4.75 stars While San Francisco is certainly known for sporting some of the best cocktails in the country, there is no question PCH is in the upper echelon even for what this city offers in that regard.  Their modern updates on classic cocktails are certainly appealing but perhaps the best drink I've ordered here was an odd number featuring sugar snap peas (the oh snap!).   Other drinks offer extraordinary attention to detail -- you may notice that even their ice cubes are branded in certain cocktails.  Travel downstairs and instead of a bathroom you may stumble into a dance party.  And on the main floor, you can either sit at the bar for quiet conversation or perhaps snuggle next to a date in the cozy nook with a tiny table meant for two.  

I don't live in SF but I certainly wouldn't be above judging a local if they didn't enjoy this bar.  Highly recommended for locals especially within the neighborhood.  For non locals, it's probably best if you have 1 to 3 friends looking for a casual evening with exceptional cocktails.
author: Yelper N.

description:
Just like Tom Cruise, this place is all Cocktails and Dreams!  The decor wraps you in a delicate ambience that makes you feel that you have already been here.  The drinks are far beyond superb, even Trump and Hillary would get along and have a great time here.  
Come for drinks stay for more drinks!!
author: Doug S.

description: These guys know wat they are doing and they are doing an amazing job. I would give them 6 stars if I can. Their coctails are must try I mean all of them, seriously. It is a very cool experience to watch the staff preparing your drink and stamping the ice. It is not only the show but the drinks are very balanced, flavorful
author: Fikret D.

description: This place is awesome. If I could give it 10 stars I Would.Not only is the atmosphere awesome, they were playing Fleetwood Mac when I walked in. I had a Pimms Cup which was absolutely delicious and beautiful. And the icing on the cake was that they use stainless steel straws instead of plastic straws which are much more environmental. I will be bringing my friends here.
author: Colin B.

description: I think i found my new chill spot. At first i didn't know what to expect when i walked in . This is one of the few times i didn't check the reviews before going to a place. At first glance i was like this joint is nice and laid back. So the crew and the big seating area in the back and was immediately greeted by one of the staffers. He brought us a few menus and told us about a few of his favorite drinks. I have to say this dudes selections were on point. So we placed our orders and started chatting up a storm then realized the music. When i hear that old school music i get pumped nothing beats some old WU Tang playing in the background. That totally caught me off guard that's a true sign of a good night. Then i hear the drinks are here the drinks are here and it's go time. I can not remember everything we ordered but each drink came out good as hell. Those are the kind of drinks that will definitely get you in trouble later and a lil trouble isn't a bad thing. i have to say my two favorite drinks were the Swizzle my Nizzle and the Pootie tang! if you are reading this and need a cool place to have drinks this is it. The ambiance and the staff are just amazing!
author: Tony B.

description: Great little bar.  Top notch service, attention to details and some really awesome drinks!
author: Jeff T.

description: Went here on a crowded night. The bar is a unique small space but the bar tenders took FOREVER to make a drink. I didn't even order something so unique or hard to make. I know it was busy but c'mon! they couldn't even remember who's drink it was when they were done - I had to flag the guy down. I would come back as long as it wasn't crowded. Or just order a beer.
author: Ruby B.

description:
This place is just fabulous. I came here on a Saturday night to celebrate my good friends upcoming nuptials and Francis was our bartender. He was friendly, attentive, and clearly very passionate about the cocktails he creates. One of the ladies in our group was expecting so he made special virgin cocktails for her. He also made me a special drink towards the end of the night that would help alleviate any ill effects I might encounter the following day! 
This bar is on the smaller side, but the decor and ambiance are very unique. The bar is very large and well stocked, and the music was on point. If I still lived in San Francisco I would be returning regularly!
author: Kelly M.

description: Wowzers amazing craft cocktails and a hip vibe to boot! We will absolutely be back again and again!
author: Maggie A.

description:
PCH is such a hip little cocktail bar with great service and really unique drinks. I love the simplicity of their menu and how there are exact drawings of each drink. 

Bartenders are very friendly and actually care about serving you quality cocktails. The first time I came here, I learned about the differences between tequila and mezcal. Our bartender also made my boyfriend a drink on the house when the first drink wasn't exactly what he had expected. 

The ambience is definitely trendy and I think it would be great for first date drinks! It is pretty small and doesn't have a lot of seating, so you might have wait at the standing bar for a seat to open up.

random: they have a little collection of Star Wars (and maybe also Marvel? I can't remember) themed tiki cups collecting above the bar. I thought this was a cute touch.
author: Estelle C.

description: Great cocktails and ambience. Long lines in Fridays, though. otherwise is a great place to meet with a friend, have a cocktail and catch up.
author: Lorely G.

description:
Pretty Crap Hellhole
TLDR: This place is absurdly over-priced to the point where it is basically highway robbery, making it essentially a bougie tourist trap.

If you are a San Francisco native, or generally reasonable person, then you will appreciate this review. Forget all these hipsters saying this is the best place for a cocktail-- it is a place where you can spend $15 to convince yourself it was worth your time to stand there while the bartender pours 20 things into an insultingly tiny glass which comes out tasting like... nothing? This place is basically for pretentious douchebags who want to drop alot of money to fill the empty hole inside their souls.

A note on the decor: though it was cheerily decorated for the Holidays, I think it's very clear that it epitomizes the neo-SF bare bones yuppie aesthetic we have come to see so ubiquitously. Like, think of something better.

BYE.
author: Marie C.

description:
This is one of the best cocktail bars I have ever been to in the whole US. From drinks, high quality mixers (gin and tonics are made with Fever Tree as an example) exquisite bartenders and friendly atmosphere. It is the perfect place for
A night out in beautiful San Francisco.
author: Sergiu S.

description: Amazing bartenders that will take the time to get to know what you like and make something that you will love and have likely never heard of. Patrick was great and made "a quick" drink into three or four. Great people and drinks if you want to find something new or just have a comfortable, familiar drink.
author: Justin C.

description: Saw that this spot was a little bit newer with some good reviews and decided to check it out. When we first arrived it was a little busy for such a small space but they really made the best use of the area they did have. It's nestled in between some hotels and other bars so it's easy to miss and walk past but please if you're in the area, stop by and check it out. The decor, service, and drinks are all amazing. We browsed the menu for a little bit and there were a lot of drinks that caught our eyes. The bartenders are very attentive and even though it was busy they noticed that we didn't have a drink or menu in our hands and waved for us to come get a menu so we could order. Even though a lot of the drinks had a lot of different fruit components in then they were by far not weak. You really get what you pay for here. We ordered the cocktails according to what we thought were weaker to stronger and it did not disappoint. Tonight was the first night I actually had an egg in one of my drinks and it was delicious. The sesame seeds on top really made a difference. If you chewed on the seeds it added a whole new and interesting new depth to the flavors. It gave it that nutty buttery flavor kind of like peanut butter to a drink that tasted like creme brulee. Overall this bar is a must go to and I will definitely be back to visit. Everyone there seemed happy and had a smile on their faces. The music was a nice mix to the atmosphere. Greatly enjoyed our time there.
author: Camera P.

description:
As lovely as Cantina seemed when I was shoulder to shoulder with sweaty young trendsters waiting to get a drink, I love the fact that I can have something at PCH previously unseen from my experiences at Cantina: space to breathe.

Bar dude Kevin Diedrich (Burritt Room, Jasper's, BDK) and Sidecar Hospitality are the masterminds behind this hip joint. Drinks are great, and I especially love that there's one named after my hometown beach are, the "Ko'olina Swizzle."

Service is friendly and not at all pretentious. Very comfortable space. "Haven," indeed.
author: Keane L.

description: Definitely a very cool place and the cocktails are original. However, they are not particularly delicious and for how expensive they are they are not very strong. Won't be back!
author: Vv V.

description: Great place to sit and watch talented, friendly mixologists at work.  My test of a great bartender is telling them what I like and don't and seeing what they come up with.  They did a great job here.  Pineapple is the star of the show so try to order something with the sweet citrus as a featured ingredient.
author: Steve G.

description: Came here on a Friday night and were able to find a seat for 6 people immediately. The wait staff was really nice and came back periodically to ask us if we needed anything. I got the "lime in a coconut" drink and it was good but definitely a creamier drink and heavier. Also ordered a vodka tonic and it was good and heavily poured. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a cool place to grab a cocktail.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great Cocktails and Great place to people watch. Must go to this exciting Bar. Had a blast!
author: Renee P.

description: Amazing drinks and bartenders!!! Wouldn't change a thing and everyone must try their cocktails. Sooo good and will come back anytime
author: Kym R.

description: Fun amazing spot in Union Square to enjoy tiki drinks. Prices are reasonable, great service, fun atmosphere.
author: Trekforbeer B.

description:
Great place to get drinks after work, although pretty crowded. Best for smaller groups of less than 4. Also, be prepared to stand. There is some seating in the back but hard to come by. 

I was pleasantly surprised at how awesome my cocktail was. I got the "Oh Snap" with gin and sugar snap pea and absinthe. It was sweet, strong, refreshing and overall delightful!
author: Jamie K.

description: Cute little cocktail bar with inventive drinks. Wasn't crazy about the 4 I tried (my wife had 2). They have one of my favorite beers on tap, which I liked too (KSA). Prices are on the high side of SF, but still reasonable.
author: Jonah K.

description: Thrilla in manila is to die for! Good luck finding this drink anywhere else in the world.
author: Matt T.

description: We came here shortly after they first opened, and found the cocktails to be less than stellar, and decided we didn't need to come back. But we recently heard that their cocktail menu got revamped, and had to taste for ourselves! We were super impressed with both the drinks we got, and had we not had plans afterward, would have definitely stayed for more. I had the "Stop and Smell the Rose", which was a fabulous and refreshing summer cocktail.  J. had the "Tuk Tuk Tea" drink that had thai tea in it! The drink was a seamless blend of the familiar Thai Tea flavor and the alcoholic taste of a cocktail. Would 100% go back.
author: Lydia W.

description:
Ladies-Infested Place! To be expected with cocktails in the name and an awesome pineapple as the logo. 

THE BAR: It seems small looking from the outside, but there's more table seatings for small groups and two large group tables. as you past the narrow bar area. As you past the bar, the lighting does go darker and kind of made it a way too romantic ambiance. 

MENU: All the cocktails looked enticing! (Check online for their menu if you want to see ahead of time). 
Swizzle My Nizzle: My friend's go-to. She likes sours and this was perfect for both of us. 
Ko'olina Swizzle: Reminds me of the tropical drinks I had in Hawaii. I tasted the pineapple and appreciated the fruity notes. 
Lime in Da Coconut: Serious dessert. Creamy with the coconut-lychee milk. Wait, does this really have alcohol? Oh, Vodka? ... okay, just checking. 

PRICE: Beware with cocktails, you can easily go from one - two - three to what? And with the pricing at $13, that bill can go high for my wallet. I would make this my go-to for a drink before dinner. if I ended up staying there longer, I might as well get the punch bowls that they offer fitting for 5-8 people.
author: Casie C.

description: You are missing out out on a unique experience if you do not go here. Crowded, but all the good places are. With that said fast service and spot on old fashion! Giant punch bowl drinks are one of the specialties and we're fun to watch them make drinks
author: Steve C.

description: Why even mess around with other cocktails in SF? This is your mother ship if you enjoy booze crafted into artistry!
author: Travis B.

description: Pretty good drinks! Very attentive waiter. And it's nice that you can also order food from next door. Only downfall was just how cold it was even when we were all the way inside even after a few drinks!! But besides that, it was a pretty good experience.
author: Nadia I.

description: Went here for a casual meeting and the ambiance and sound levels were perfect for chatting. Drinks were unique and the servers were very helpful.
author: Alex G.

description: This spot became our favorite cocktail bar in SF, while on vacation from New York City. Not overly crowded, good music and solid drinks. The bartenders were very friendly and did a great job.
author: Tri W.

description: Came here with two of my girlfriends to get cocktails. We got a little lost on the way there and as a result came in with a minute to spare before happy hour ended (it runs from 5-7pm). Our waiter was very nice though and allowed us to order from the happy hour menu. Walking in we loved the ambiance until we tried to read the menu and realized we practically needed flashlights. One friend had the single village hi-ball, the other had the Normandy hi-ball and i cant remember the name of mine but it had root beer in the description and tasted like black licorice. My drink was fantastic but my friends village hi-ball was dreadful. She sent it back once, but felt awful considering they'd been so nice to accommodate us. The second one was worse than the first but she politely drank it.  It was not our scene and we will not be returning, but I could see the draw for a more hipster crowd.
author: Kelsey H.

description: Awesome vibes and great tropical drinks that aren't too sweet. Go with a group and share a punch!!!
author: Sophie J.

description: Very good drinks. Good service and attentive. Highly recommend if you are wanting a good craft cocktail.
author: Scott A.

description: I went here for their special themed pop-up that they had over the holidays.  It was very nice and the decor was really good.  They gave you the option to buy the drink glasses there too and I got a cute Santa one.  Not sure what it's like "off-season" but I imagine pretty good.  Great service too.
author: a f.

description:
As a NYC resident for 6 hours, I had my fair share of cocktails at the Pegu Club and Raines Law Room.

Stopping in on a Wednesday night, the place was pretty popping and the vibe was pretty chill.

A crucial aspect of a cocktail bar is the bartender and all three of them were very nice and accommodating. The one that served me was Miguel and he previously worked at Pianos in NYC and puts a lot of effort and passion into his craft. He also took the time out to go over several notable drinks on the menu.

The drinks I had were Swizzle My Nizzle and The Fourth Regiment. Both were perfect for my taste as I do not prefer drinks too sweet.

Great spot.
author: Eric L.

description: PCH, affectionately named after the most beautiful highway in California (as I like to think), is modest in appearance, and dynamic in drinks. PCH takes the best elements of "tiki" bar, and makes everything its own (PCH is not a tiki bar - no tacky tiki-ness here). The drinks are island inspired, and there are a few tiki statues on the bar shelves, but that's about as far as it goes. I came here early on a Saturday night (just after 10pm), and there was a decent crowd, but definitely comfortable for someone who doesn't enjoy super crowded or super loud places. The crowd is mixed in age, and the music was a good mix of 90s and current r&b/hip-hop. I tried a few of their rum and whisky drinks, and the definite winner was the Ko'Olina Swizzle, but the Tuk Tuk Tea (thai-tea inspired) was a strong second. The tartness in the Ko'Olina made for a bright drink. Most cocktails here are $12-13, and I don't recall seeing anything cheaper, but you get what you pay for here. PCH keeps things casually cool - great place to meet up with a few friends (larger seating areas are limited), or take a date. Cheers!
author: Jennifer H.

description: I usually drop in here for a night cap after slowly bar crawling home. They have a great drink menu and whisky concoctions are great. The Bobby Burns is one of my favorites because not only do you get a cocktail but you get a second portion. It's like two drinks in one!
author: Ryan C.

description: Delicious unique cocktails served in beautiful glasses. There is an eclectic mix of music and people with the place starting to buzz at around 9:30PM. Tip: Get a seat at the bar; the bartenders are friendly and watching them craft cocktails is both fascinating and captivating. I'll definitely be back!
author: Erika M.

description:
Amazing cocktails, great ambience and overall, a great place to spend your evening. We were on a date and couldn't have asked for a better evening.

Cocktails of special mention- oh snap, saffron and deja vu.
Cocktails to miss- vodka in da coconut is on the sweeter side, if that's not your palate.
author: Priyanshu J.

description: Very cool space, great decor, great drinks and friendly bartenders. You can get food from Hogwash next door ANOTHER awesome spot!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
I checked out PCH last night with a group of friends, and the reviews were mixed. 

Pros: I loved the vibe and decor. Our server was great, too. 

Non-pro #1: We tried three of their custom cockails. Two of them were pretty sweet, which isn't really my jam. The third was just not good. So not good that my friend actually ordered a different drink. Our awesome server happily obliged, and didn't charge my friend for that drink. 

Non-pro #2: The music was good, but REALLY loud. Like, "too hard to hear your friends even when they're shouting" loud. 

I'd definitely give this place another shot, but will be more careful with my drink choice!
author: Connie S.

description: Love love love this place!!! So different and amazing. The quality of drinks is insane. So much time and effort is put into making them. Each drink I tried was amazing and the service was just lovely. I will definitely be back!!!
author: Micaela N.

description: Cocktails are okay. The place fills up later in the evening and isn't all that comfortable. You can get a sense that they are trying to be creative with their cocktails, which is a positive for sure. Nonetheless, the drinks we ordered felt like they were not very well balanced.
author: Matthew M.

description: I rarely give a place 5 stars. I love this cocktail bar. The drinks are inventive, delicious, and unpretentious, just like the staff ;)  I love the ice cubes - they know what's up here. So much more relaxed and fun than the Gen Gen room across the street. I'll be a regular.
author: Mark S.

description:
I like this place. It has a good vibe. 
The music is good but quite loud
They had some good choice of cocktails 
I tried 2 cocktails - blinker and saffron
Saffron had a smoke pineapple which gave it a weird taste.
Blinker was good. 

The bartenders are so good. They made me a cocktail  with my choice of alcohol which was not on the menu.
author: Prashanth V.

description: So so so good! Great service and great drinks! Music selection was on point and it's really chill and vibes were perfect for a drink or two. Intimate setting for sure
author: Daja W.

description:
Tremendous. 

Delicious cockatails. That's the best way to spell that word. Love the location. Tried a few different bevs recommended by the bartender and enjoyed the trip down creative cocktail lane. Fave had rum and a cayenne sugar rim.  

Ask for Kevin. Because he rocks. His drinks are best in the city.
author: Jeremi M.

description:
Been going here for a long time (before it was reopened as PCH). Love the atmosphere. Very chill and fun, not too loud, and the crew is very nice. Drinks are all very tasty also.

Would highly recommend for a casual drinks w/friends or for a date.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I think this place is run by a mad man. There is wallpaper on one wall that is amazing. and exposed brick on the other wall, also amazing. He must not of been able to make up his mind if he liked wall paper or brick and decided to have both. 

The menu is a assault on the senses! So much to read and see and taste, really too much to read, I am not a big reader. There are offerings from #Gin, #Whisky, #Brandy. (I am using # right). My personal favorite was the Bobby Burns. A scotch cocktail of a rare delight. I think everyone should drink this scotch cocktail featuring Cutty Sark Prohibition #whisky. A whisky of fine elegance and distinction.

The #beer is great, they have Field works on draft, my personal favorite brewery in the bay area. And make sure not to miss the bottle water feature. They bottle their own water, very fancy for a bar. Most people just put it in a glass in front of you. Not his mad man, he puts it in a bottle for you! So classy.

The food was amazing as well. Try the candied cherries or the brined olives for a unique small bite experience. If that is to heavy for you ask for the shiso salad. Hand picked shiso served inside of a cocktail glass! and it comes with Rum and lime as well. If you are feeling a little religious and really who isn't these day go for the Monks Buck. A cocktail experience like i have never had, well except for the wine in church.

Last but certainly not least, this owner must be a super nerd with terrible taste in sports. He has superhero coffee cups all over the bar. Star wars soda glasses full of straws, when I asked what was in the cup and if i can drink it they said nothing... I was very confused why a cup had so many straws with no beverage. I also saw a Washington RedSkins mug, by far the worse sports team in the history of sports. This is all forgiven because everything else was 5 stars.

All in all this is an amazing destination for anyone who is looking for 5 star cocktails, 5 star service, 5 star beer, 5 star wall paper, 5 star bottled water, 5 star whisky collection, 5 star bar top, 5 star glass ware, 5 star 5 stars.
author: brian m.

description:
Cocktails are really delicious and the bar tenders are very nice.  This is a good chill spot to have a drink or 2 before going out.

Thank you for making me a happy Jew!!
author: David F.

description: I like artisan cocktails and they deliver. Extensive menu, incredibly friendly bartenders, and they all really know their spirits. Our bartender explained to us the difference between rye and bourbon and I appreciated that. Always a wonderful time here.
author: Cathy L.

description:
Cocktails were delicious and fancy-pantz.  They actually stamp the bar initials into your ice for several cocktails with a brand!!!  And though the bar was crowded and busy, the service remained speedy and friendly.  Prices were a little high $13-14 for cocktails, but that's not unusual for SF.

Probably the only negative is no hooks under the wall bar to hang your things, so everyone's jackets were rolled into balls on the counter leaving little room for drinks.
author: Sasha R.

description: Really fabulous drinks - spicy Swizzle My Nizzle and refreshing Oh Snap. Think it was the owner serving us, really nice and attentive and was fun to have a seat at the bar to watch him work his magic. Lots of creative drink options. Nice ambiance and decor. Also really liked the fancy metal straws.... I'm sure there is a fancier proper bar term for these but I shall dub them fancy metal straws for now. ALSO the ice cubes are like what???? So cool how do they get them like that? Big rectangular one in Oh Snap.. saw the bar tender branding ice cubes in another drink. Lots of attention to detail, A+!
author: Katie N.

description: The crafted cocktails are not something you will get anywhere else I have been in the city. Talk about a cool ambiance with the dark brick and the alcohol climbing the bar behind the stations. Everyone in here was helpful and the clientele were fun to talk too also. If you can get a spot in the back don't let it go!
author: Thomas K.

description: Great place to get your craft cocktail on with friends. Attentive service with an unpretentious, and laid back atmosphere.
author: Kimi G.

description:
My friend and I had a moment of confusion when we walked through the door of PCH. We definitely had been there before, but the bar had a different name and a slightly different vibe. I recognized the same bar manager as before, so I knew I wasn't totally off my rocker. So yes, PCH has an updated vibe and a more tiki-focused menu that what it was before, which is a plus. The decor itself is a little mismatched and lacks a cohesive feel from space to space, but overall a very inviting environment. We stood at the counter along the wall for a bit, waiting for space at the bar to open up. I was disappointed that there weren't wall hooks to hang our jackets and bags. 

The first cocktail that I ordered was the Blinker (rye, raspberry and grapefruit) and my friend got the Kingston Crusta (rum, maraschino, ginger, citrus, cayenne, bitters). Both drinks were served in beautiful glassware, but I liked the taste of the Kingston Crusta better. Thankfully as we were finishing up our first drink, two spots opened at the bar and we grabbed them. By this point (6ish), the bar was starting to fill up. For our second round, I ordered the Naked Mai Tai (rum, combier, orgeat, and bitters) and my friend got the Eastern Promises (gin, cocchi rosa, black pepper, lemongrass, bitters). Again, I liked her drink more than mine. The Naked Mai Tai was STRONG and I had a hard time tasting the distinct ingredients. However, the ice cube in my drink was very impressive (they somehow managed to get PCH onto the ice cube with some kind of stamp/brand. By the time we finished up our second drink, the place was packed and we were ready to find a more quiet (and less expensive) place.
author: Regina L.

description: Very rude security with an attitude. First time visitor, I was waiting in the line to join my friends at the bar. He made me feel like I don't deserve to be here. And I came to spend my money. Won't ever come back again
author: Schroen N.

description: This place is a must for a great cocktail! Amazing bartenders who have honed their craft to perfection! If you don't stop by you're just stupid!
author: Denny S.

description:
Cool little Tiki style bar, be carful it fills up during the weekend. 

The bartenders are very knowledgeable here. After ordering a few cocktails from the menu we decided to have them make a cocktail of their choice off them menu. After a few preference questions they made some pretty amazing drinks.
author: Thomas R.

description: Made me an excellent Old Fashioned, Wisconsin-style. And so cute during the Festichristmahannukwanzakah season.
author: Matte E.

description: The coconut lime drink is da bomb!!! Great drinks and great ambiance. Probably gets packed on weekend so come early!
author: Penny Z.

description: We were greeted right away with menus (even while it was pretty busy) the drinks are fabulous, fresh and the service is quick and very friendly. What more can you ask. My advice, sit at the bar so you can see the bartenders make their masterpieces with the drinks, it's truly impressive.
author: Kristin W.

description: This place is awesome! Incredible drinks and even better customer service. I've been here 3-4 times now and the bartenders couldn't have been more friendly each visit. After one or two cocktails it can get a bit pricey but these are quality drinks! Great place to stop for a one-off before dinner some night.
author: Charley A.

description: Extremely impressive! My drink pick is the Ward Eight. Not only was Miguel our gracious bartender, he was also an artist while mixing these amazing drinks! Visiting from Ohio but I will return just for this bar. :)
author: Leslee M.

description:
Drinks are phenomenal. Atmosphere is great. I recommend sitting at the bar so you can see how the drinks are made and chat up the bartenders. All the bartenders were incredibly nice, attentive and answered many questions asked by my husband and other patrons sitting at the bar. The music is great. It was a bit loud but at the same time did not take away from the conversations I had with my husband or the bartenders. 
These are not your typical craft cocktails. You can tell the bar staff take great care and consideration in creating these delicious concoctions that are not typically found in a craft cocktail book or bar.
author: Rene R.

description: A beautiful place: intimate, candlelight, strong drinks, comfortable couches, engraved ice, and creative glassware. I will have to come back to try out some more of the drinks. However, I must say that the prices here are steep, but it is Union Square, so I can not complain much. Great mixology skills here.
author: Nikita K.

description: The cocktails here were pretty unique and tasty. I'll definitely visit again. They don't serve any food though.
author: Uma N.

description: We had a great experience here on a Friday night. We were able to get a table in the back and ordered two drinks each. The waiter gave great recommendations when I described the type of  cocktail I like.
author: Carrie C.

description: I love this cocktail bar.  It really is one of the best in the nation.  Every cocktail I've had there has been crafted carefully with style, grace, & attention to detail.
author: James L.

description: Chill vibe, fun drinks, good times. The bartenders are nice. One was showing me how they make the miso butter rum in-house.
author: Mila C.

description: One of the newest bars to open in the city. We opted for the ko'olina swizzle and the swizzle my nizzle. Both of these cocktails are super delicious! Definitely recommend this place for a fancy cocktail night! The only thing I dislike is when I received the bill and noticed they charge tax on top of the menu price! Other than that, I wouldn't mind trying a few other drink options in the near future.
author: EccentricAura A.

description: The cocktails here are delicious and are carefully crafted by the bartenders! The menu is quite diverse with unique ingredients that you won't find at other cocktail bars in the city. Each time I come I try to order different drinks, and I am never disappointed. If you like cocktails, this is definitely the place for you!
author: Roberta V.

description: Miguel is the absolute man. After a long conversation and plenty of explanation of the drinks here, we got the miso old fashion, oh snap and the lucky melon. They were absolutely outstanding. If you are looking for something trendy with some crazy talented bartenders this is the spot. If I could give it 10 stars, I would!
author: Ryan G.

description: I give this place 3 stars just because to me it's neutral. They ONLY serve cocktails, no food. The reason why it wasn't anything special is because the drinks were a little too unfamiliar for me. The place had a good ambiance tho.
author: Brandon D.

description:
ambiance//*****
bar up front is set up properly
small lounge area in the back...yay comfy seating!!
and i think there is a basement floor that may be negotiate for private events...or so i'm told

service//*****
their crew is fairly attentive and very pleasant
we were there for a good hour or so....never feeling rushed
that and they kept checking on us so we just kept ordering

drinks//*****
oohlala~ menu of adorable drinks look like a sketch of a design to be experienced in person
we ordered a few and not only were they visually beautiful, they were all delicious af

my friend had some girly drinks like ka'olina swizzle, swizzle my nizzle, and lime in da coconut 
i had the blinker and my hands down favorite mum's the word...both drinks were good but mum was so pretty i had to IG that 
#icegame strong says something when i don't even like ice in my beverages

point being whether you like them light and fruity or strong and simple...they have everything
~*~
if you're attached to the previous bar, it may take you a while to come around like my friend
or if you're like me...be an equal opportunity drinker ;p you won't be disappointed!

thx to Hao L. for being my barhopping buddy!
author: Donna S.

description: Super nice bartenders, amazing music (so that in itself deserves 5 stars alone, and...just come and drink the "Lime in da Coconut"...so yummmmz.
author: Clarissa M.

description: Our group had an Oh Snap!, Lime in de Coconut, and the big Winter Cup. I noticed the bartenders making customers' drink with care, and I really liked that. The staff was very friendly and I felt that the bartenders were genuine with their craft. All the drinks were on point tonight, thank you!
author: Miguel G.

description: PCH, your drinks are strong, and your bartenders are knowledgable. Your patrons are also hilariously hitting on people while in various states of massive intoxication. Thank goodness your bouncer is also hilarious. It will take you a while to get to the bar, so be patient. The bartenders work quickly, but they're crafting lots of different drinks - be kind, they're doing a great job. There are two reasons why I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 4 or 5. The first is that, even for a hipster craft cocktail establishment, this place is insanely expensive. It's $90 for a bowl of punch, whereas even at Whitechapel, you can get a bowl for $50-60. The second is just the ingress and egress. Whoever put this place together, and said the bar would be in a prime location where it is, should not get another job. It's impossible to walk around this place without bumping into numerous people. I like the drinks, the music, and the ambiance, but I'll pass on coming back. There's nothing that I can't find elsewhere at a lower price point.
author: Danny C.

description: Great decor, amazing staff, absolutely unique selection of complex drinks with astonishing flavors. They have a selection of Japanese Whisky like I've rarely seen! great time!
author: Alexandre V.

description:
Great place.

Get there early, this joint is jumping!

Really well done drinks... artful. 

The decor is upbeat.

Its worth the wait.
author: R C.

description: Expensive drinks filled with ice and a small shot of Alcohol. Order an over priced beer to at least kind of get your monies worth.
author: E K.

description: Had a really fun Mai Tai twist which had no citrus. Kevin and Adrian were super friendly. Amazing to see how much the space has been transformed from the old Cantina days! Looking forward to popping by more often!
author: Zachary T.

description: Awesome spot. Friendly staff and more importantly delicious drinks. I will definitely make this a regular stop because all that tequila isn't going to drink itself.
author: Traci V.

description: Kevin Dietrich strikes again. #nailedit
author: Maggie D.

description: Been to PCH a couple of times now. Great unique drinks. Maybe a little Asian influence there with some of the flavors! My favorite drink there has been the "Cawfee Tawlk" not sure about spelling, but it's supposed to be "Coffee Talk" with an accent. Haha. Vodka based drink, and it's damn good! Might be the drip coffee they use? Bottom line, delish. My go-to drink. I believe we have ordered food from Hogwash and have been able to eat it at PCH? Perhaps since they share the restroom area space. Fun times here, but it was a bit loud so if you wanted to have a decent conversation, perk them ears up and project your voice! One thing about this bar is that since it shares the restroom space with Hogwash, it can be a bit of a wait to use the toilet. Just a head's up! And it's nothing fancy either so don't expect much. See ya again next time, PCH!
author: Mariel A.

description: Creative cocktails, super friendly staff, dim lighting, great music.  Wasn't much else I could ask for. Had a great time, now one of my favorite bars.
author: Jon L.

description: We ordered one of their enormous fish bowls. It was delicious and served more people than the menu even said. The only think lacking here is atmosphere. It was a little bland and it's a fairly small place so make reservations or come early to get a seat at the bar.
author: Carey T.

description: the menu is kinda short but the ones i tried tasted really good! interior is cute too :)
author: Yeonhwa S.

description: This place is truly a haven for delicious drinks. One night- 6 drinks later, and not a single one that we didn't like. 6/6 approval rating, 5/5 stars, all in all this place is the new spot to tell your friends about. Don't let the unconventional ingredients deter you from a worthwhile experience. A whole egg, matcha, yogurt extract, sesame seeds... just go with it and find out which one you like the most.
author: Brianna S.

description: Just had the most delectable libation. A feast for the eyes and the palette longs for more.
author: Silvanita R.

description: Had the saffron, a mezcal and pineapple cocktail. Really great cocktail for a reasonable high quality cocktail price, 13$ I think. Bartenders were very quick and happy to make the cocktails. Good atmosphere early in the night around 730ish.
author: William S.

description: I've been here a few times now and really like the drinks.  However, last time we were sitting at a table,  the waiter asked us if we wanted another drink.  We said no, and he came back in a few minutes, took my drink I wasn't done with and gave us the bill!  Really unprofessional - I know you want to get another party at the table, but please let me finish my $15+ cocktail first.
author: whatever I.

description: Some of the best cocktails in SF. The staff is courteous and attentive. Intimate seating for groups in the back. only drawback is that it's a smallish place and gets pretty crowded on a friday night. If you come during the off-time though, the staff is happy to help you select your drink and chat about their scotches (great selection).
author: Mark M.

description: Loved the small bar feel, decor, and ambiance. But dang - over priced small drinks. Even my beer was small. For $14 you'd think the martini would be served in a full sized martini glass. Right?
author: Jack C.

description: Great ambiance. Great drinks! Bartenders definitely know what they're doing. Must try if you're in San Fran
author: Brenda S.

description: Awesome drinks! Hands down the best cocktail place in SF right now. Super balances, creative recipes and they're pretty strong :)
author: Priti P.

description: My favorite cocktail bar in the city! The bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable about all drink options. PCH has a well done and diverse drink list, but it is simple enough to follow. The menu gives you a description of each drink and a physical depiction of it as well. You can tell that they really put effort into every drink. I mean, they probably have over 5 different types of ice to perfectly fit any given beverage. They take care of all of the details, whether that be placing a perfect garnish or literally branding one of their over-sized ice cubes with their PCH logo! The only real problem with this place is that you'll feel the need to try everything before you go! Good for both first date drinks or a place to hang with friends and have some fabulous drinks. Current favorites are the Swizzle my Nizzle, Bay Bridge Buck, or Classic Moscow Mule; but really everything is worth a try at this place! I'll definitely be back... again
author: Lauren P.

description: Delicious, adventurous cocktails in a beautiful space - plus a friendly and unpretentious staff with none of the hipster 'too cool for school' attitude you find at so many other bars in SF! When we found one of our drinks too sweet, they immediately struck it from the tab and replaced it. We liked the Swizzle my Nizzle, Santorini Summer, and Shizo Delicioso. Would definitely recommend!
author: Lara B.

description: Love this bar.  If I could live downstairs I would.  Extremely creative cocktails, friendly for all types of palates.  The punch bowls are beautiful and so is the staff.  One of the most welcoming and hospitable staffs in the city.  Sadatay my dammies.
author: Brian M.

description: Came for an after work drink and was pleasantly surprise by their bar program.  I had the swizzle my Nizzle and the habanero bitters went perfect with the tequila base drink.  Had a some heat but just the right amount.  Nice balance drink!  Didn't get a chance to try any others but will be back for sure.  This place use to be the Cantina which I went to once and the lay out hasn't changed much.  Lower level was closed so I didn't get a chance to see what's downstairs.  Will be back as there was a few more drinks I wanted to try.  I give this place a thumbs up!
author: John B.

description:
Really like this place. It has a good vibe. 
The music is good but quite loud
They had some good choice of cocktails, will def come back with a group
author: Suzie H.

description:
Drinks were great. Our bartenders were friendly and helpful in finding places to visit during our road trip. Love the decor. 
Will be coming back next trip to San Francisco.
author: Jenya S.

description: I was blown away... This spot is amazing and and a must go to.... If you are into great drinks, great service and fine details...
author: Maricel A.

description: I like the vibe of the main room, although my god the restroom is terrible. But the bar has a nice feel and the bartenders and staff were very nice. Drinks were ok. Too sweet for me as a whole, but could be promising and maybe we ordered the wrong ones. But I bet that most of the drinks are pretty sweet.
author: Amjad S.

description: The music is so loud you can't speak. I asked for a zombie and the bar tender didn't know how to do it, so he used an app to make it. It was nothing like the cocktail it should be and they charged me randomly for 18$ for a little glass of something which I wouldn't call zombie...
author: Zoltan F.

description:
I always measure the quality of a cocktail bar by how perfect they can make the world's first cocktail, the old fashioned.   Hence the name.  It's the gold standard.  It needs to be made in the tradition of a clean and neat drink.   The way George Washington would have made it.  This Is usually how I order.  "Make it like George would have".   Proper attention to detail is the only way to differentiate, since the ingredients are so basic.  Rye, simple sugar, bitters, orange and lemon garnish and ice.  I've had them with muddled fruit, seltzer, cherries etc..  To me those additions are mere distractions and disqualifies the establishment from further patronage.   

Let's break it down.   At PCH  each element of the old fashioned was made to perfection.  I'd say it was the best one I'd ever purchased, even better than my own.   Starting with the right glass(low tumbler), they add clear ice that is cut on-site to fit the glass, they even "stamp" the ice PCH with a special tool while making the drink.  The right amount of rye, bitters and sugar is added into a glass beaker.  It Is stirred not shaken within a generous amount of small ice cubes to achieve maximum chilling. This is critical, it must be small ice cubes that have more surface area then large ones.  This ice must be very cold to the point where it feels dry so as to NOT water down the cocktail.  Then they rim the glass with fresh cut lemon rinds.  It can't be pre cut because the lemons loose their essence over time. They start drying out when left out on the bar.  They pour the cocktail into the low tumbler to 2/3 full. This is critical to keep the lemon and orange scent persistent while enjoying the drink.   Just awesome execution.   A+.
author: Doug D.

description: Amazing cocktail menu. They take mixology to a whole new level.  Super enjoyable old school music too.
author: Vanie M.

description: GREAT cocktails, solid vibe but not a place to come in a hurry. The drinks are all carefully crafted so understandably take a while to make.
author: Whitney T.

description: I love the way the menus are laid out by alcohol type. You can also have food brought in from Hogwash next door. Cocktails are a little out there but great!
author: Kate S.

description: amazing cocktails with great bartenders who are super talented and attentive to the drinks they're creating.  its a great space and low key vibe with great drinks.  definitely stop by! its a really amazing bar.
author: F S.
